sentence:
Cookies and similar technologies
What is a cookie?
label: None

sentence: We and our partners use cookies and similar technologies, such as tags and pixels (“Cookies”), to personalise and improve your customer experience as you use our Websites and Mobile Apps and to provide you with relevant online advertising.
label: None

sentence: This section provides more information about Cookies, including how we use them and how you can exercise your choices about our use of Cookies.
label: None

sentence: A Cookie is a small text file, often encrypted, that is placed in your web browser on your receiving terminal (your PC, telephone, tablet, or any other device) when you visit a website.
label: None

sentence: During the course of your visit to that website, and on subsequent visits, it sends information from your browser which contains information about your visit(s).
label: None

sentence: They do not damage your computer.
label: None

sentence: They can be used only for the duration of your visit or they can be used to measure how you interact with services and content over time.
label: None

sentence: Cookies help to provide important features and functionality on our Websites and Mobile Apps, and to improve your customer experience.
label: None

sentence: We use cookies to distinguish you from other users of the Site, to provide a seamless experience and to monitor where we need to make improvements.
label: None

sentence: We also use cookies for advertising purposes.
label: None

sentence: Some of the cookies we use are necessary for the Site to function; other cookies are in place to make the Site more user-friendly, and for analytic purposes.
label: None

sentence:
When you consent to Cookies on our Services, these may be used to do the following:

Improve the way our Websites and Mobile Apps work
label: None

sentence: Cookies allow us to improve the way our Websites and Mobile Apps work so that we can personalise your experience and allow you to use many of their useful features.
label: None

sentence: For example, we use Cookies so we can remember your preferences and the contents of your shopping basket when you return to our Websites and Mobile Apps.
label: None

sentence: Improve the performance of our Websites and Mobile Apps
label: None

sentence: Cookies can help us to understand how our Websites and Mobile Apps are being used, for example, by telling us if you get an error messages as you browse.
label: None

sentence: These Cookies collect data that is mostly aggregated and anonymous.
label: None

sentence: Deliver relevant online advertising including via social media
label: None

sentence: We use Cookies to help us deliver online advertising that we believe is most relevant to you on our Websites, on other organisations’ websites and using social media.
label: None

sentence: Cookies used for this purpose are often placed on our Websites by specialist organisations.
label: None

sentence: Cookies used for this purpose are often placed on our Websites by organisations providing specialist services to us.
label: None

sentence: These Cookies may collect information about your online behaviour, such as your IP address, the website you arrived from and information about your purchase history or the content of your shopping basket.
label: None

sentence: This means that you may see our adverts on our Websites and on other organisations’ websites.
label: None

sentence: You may also see adverts for other organisations on our Websites.
label: None

sentence: To help us to deliver online advertising that is relevant to you, we may also combine data we collect through Cookies in the browser of your desktop computer or other devices with other data that we have collected, for example your use of Clubcard and in-store purchases.
label: None

sentence:
Measuring the effectiveness of our marketing communications, including online advertising
Cookies can tell us if you have seen a specific advert, and how long it has been since you have seen it.
label: None

sentence: This information allows us to measure the effectiveness of our online advertising campaigns and control the number of times you are shown an advert.
label: None

sentence: We also use Cookies to measure the effectiveness of our marketing communications, for example by telling us if you have opened a marketing email that we have sent you.
label: None

sentence: What types of cookies do we use?
label: None

sentence:
We use the following categories of cookies:

Session cookies - These enable your web browser to remember which pages on our Site have already been visited and what actions have been taken in a session.
label: None

sentence: Session cookies allow users to be recognized within a website so any page changes or item or data selection you do is remembered from page to page.
label: None

sentence: The most common example of this functionality is the shopping cart feature of any e-commerce site.
label: None

sentence: When you visit one page of a catalogue and select some items, the session cookie remembers your selection so your shopping cart will have the items you selected when you are ready to check out.
label: None

sentence: Without session cookies, if you click
label: None

sentence: CHECKOUT, the new page does not recognize your past activities on prior pages and your shopping cart will always be empty.
label: None

sentence: Session cookies do not collect information from the user's computer.
label: None

How to do this will depend on the browser you use and we provide further detail below on how to disable cookies for the most popular browsers:

For Microsoft Internet Explorer:

Choose the menu "tools" then "Internet Options"
Click on the "privacy" tab
Select the setting the appropriate setting
For Mozilla Firefox:

Choose the menu "tools" then "Options"
Click on the icon "privacy"
Find the menu "cookie" and select the relevant options
For Safari:

Choose Safari > Preferences, click Privacy, then do any of the following: Change which cookies and website data are accepted
Select a "Cookies and website data" option: Always block: Safari doesn't let any websites, third parties, or advertisers store cookies and other data on your Mac

Improve the way our Websites and Mobile Apps work

Information Collected Through Automatic Data Collection Technologies
As you navigate through and interact with our Website, we use automatic data collection technologies to collect certain information about your equipment, browsing actions and patterns, including information such as your IP address, browser type, operating system, the referring web page, pages visited, location, your mobile carrier, device information, search terms, and cookie information.

Cookies (or browser cookies).
label: None

sentence: Cookies are small text files that are stored in your web browser or downloaded to your device when you visit a website.
label: None

sentence: Cookies are then sent back to the originating website on each subsequent visit, or to another website that recognizes that cookie, and allow a website to recognize a user’s device.
label: None

sentence:
We currently use the following types of cookies:

Cookies that are strictly necessary: These are cookies that are required for the operation of our Website.
label: None

sentence: These include, for example, cookies that enable a user to log in to our Website and to check if a user is allowed access to a particular service or content.
label: None

label: None

sentence: These cookies help us to improve our Website, for example by ensuring that all users are able to find what they are looking for easily.
label: None

sentence: Functionality cookies: These cookies are not essential, but help us to personalize and enhance your online experience on our Website.
label: None

sentence: This type of cookies allows us to recognize you when you return to our Website and to remember, for example, your choice of language.
label: None

sentence: Targeting cookies: These cookies record the visit of a user on our Website, the pages a user has visited and the links a user has followed in order to enable us to make our Website more relevant to the users' interests.
label: None

label: None

label: None

label: None

Data processing - deutschepost.de

Collection and processing of personal data

When you visit our websites, our web servers temporarily store the following information as standard for the purpose of system security: the connection data of the requesting computer system, which of our websites you visit, the date and length of your visit, the data identifying the type of browser and operating system used, and the website from which you visit us.
label: None

sentence: Other personal data, such as your name, address, telephone number or e-mail address, is not collected unless you provide this data voluntarily, for example as part of a registration procedure, survey, competition, performance of a contract or request for information.
label: None

sentence:
Use and forwarding of personal data

We use the personal data provided by you exclusively for the purpose of technical administration of our websites and to fulfill your wishes and requirements, i.e. generally to perform the contract concluded with you or to respond to your inquiry.
label: None

sentence: We only use such data for product-related surveys and marketing purposes if you have given us your prior consent and if you have not filed an objection, insofar as this is permitted by law.

label: None

Use of cookies

Cookies are small files that enable us to store information related specifically to you, the user, on your PC while you visit one of our websites.
label: None

label: None

label: None

label: None

sentence: On the other, we use “persistent cookies” to retain information about visitors who repeatedly access one of our Internet pages.
label: None

label: None

sentence:
Telegram Privacy Policy

1. Introduction
This Privacy Policy sets out how we, Telegram Messenger Inc. (“Telegram”), use and protect your personal data that you provide to us, or that is otherwise obtained or generated by us, in connection with your use of our cloud-based messaging services (the “Services”).
label: None

sentence: For the purposes of this Privacy Policy, ‘we’, ‘us’ and ‘our’ refers to Telegram, and ‘you’ refers to you, the user of the Services.
label: None

sentence:
1.1 Privacy Principles
Telegram has two fundamental principles when it comes to collecting and processing private data:

We don't use your data to show you ads.
label: None

sentence: We only store the data that Telegram needs to function as a secure and feature-rich messaging service.
label: None

sentence:
1.2. Terms of Service
This Privacy Policy forms part of our Terms of Service, which describes the terms under which you use our Services and which are available at https://telegram.org/tos.
label: None

sentence: This Privacy Policy should therefore be read in conjunction with those terms.
label: None
None

who your personal data may be shared with; and
your rights regarding your personal data.

sentence: If you live in a country in the European Economic Area (EEA), the Services are provided by Telegram, which for the purposes of applicable data protection legislation is the data controller responsible for your personal data when you use our Services.
label: None

sentence: However, as Telegram is located outside the EEA, we have designated one of our EEA-based group companies, Telegram UK Holdings Ltd (71-75 Shelton Street, Covent Garden, London, England, WC2H 9JQ), as a representative to whom you may direct any issues you have relating to our processing of your personal data.
label: None

sentence:
2. Legal Ground for Processing Your Personal Data
We process your personal data on the ground that such processing is necessary to further our legitimate interests (including: (1) providing effective and innovative Services to our users; and (2) to detect, prevent or otherwise address fraud or security issues in respect of our provision of Services), unless those interests are overridden by your interest or fundamental rights and freedoms that require protections of personal data.
label: None

sentence: 3. What Personal Data We Use
label: None

sentence: 3.1. Basic Account Data
label: None

sentence: Telegram is a communication service.
label: None

sentence: You provide your mobile number and basic account data (which may include profile name, profile picture and about information) to create a Telegram account.
label: None

sentence: To make it easier for your contacts and other people to reach you and recognize who you are, the screen name you choose, your profile pictures, and your username (should you choose to set one) on Telegram are always public.
label: None

sentence: We don't want to know your real name, gender, age or what you like.
label: None

sentence: We do not require your screen name to be your real name.
label: None

sentence: Note that users who have you in their contacts will see you by the name they saved and not by your screen name.
label: None

sentence: This way your mother can have the public name 'Johnny Depp' while appearing as 'Mom' to you and as 'Boss' to her underlings at work (or the other way around, depending on how these relationships are structured).
label: None

sentence:
3.2. Your E-mail Address
When you enable 2-step-verification for your account or store documents using the Telegram Passport feature, you can opt to set up a password recovery email.
label: None

sentence: This address will only be used to send you a password recovery code if you forget it.
label: None

sentence: That's right: no marketing or “we miss you” bullshit.
label: None

sentence: Cloud Chats
label: None

sentence: Telegram is a cloud service.
label: None

sentence: We store messages, photos, videos and documents from your cloud chats on our servers so that you can access your data from any of your devices anytime without having to rely on third-party backups.
label: None

sentence: All data is stored heavily encrypted and the encryption keys in each case are stored in several other data centers in different jurisdictions.
label: None

sentence: This way local engineers or physical intruders cannot get access to user data.
label: None

sentence:
Chats
Secret chats use end-to-end encryption.
label: None

sentence: This means that all data is encrypted with a key that only you and the recipient know.
label: None

sentence: There is no way for us or anybody else without direct access to your device to learn what content is being sent in those messages.
label: None

sentence: We do not store your secret chats on our servers.
label: None

sentence: We also do not keep any logs for messages in secret chats, so after a short period of time we no longer know who or when you messaged via secret chats.
label: None

sentence: For the same reasons secret chats are not available in the cloud — you can only access those messages from the device they were sent to or from.
label: None

sentence:
3.3.3. Media in Secret Chats
When you send photos, videos or files via secret chats, before being uploaded, each item is encrypted with a separate key, not known to the server.
label: None

sentence: This key and the file’s location are then encrypted again, this time with the secret chat’s key — and sent to your recipient.
label: None

sentence: They can then download and decipher the file.
label: None

sentence: This means that the file is technically on one of Telegram’s servers, but it looks like a piece of random indecipherable garbage to everyone except for you and the recipient.
label: None

sentence: We don’t know what this random data stands for and we have no idea which particular chat it belongs to.
label: None

sentence: We periodically purge this random data from our servers to save disk space.
label: None

sentence: Chats
label: None

sentence: In addition to private messages, Telegram also supports public channels and public groups.
label: None

sentence: All public chats are cloud chats (see section 3.3.1 above).
label: None

sentence: Like everything on Telegram, the data you post in public communities is encrypted, both in storage and in transit — but everything you post in public will be accessible to everyone.
label: None

sentence:
3.4. Phone Number and Contacts
Telegram uses phone numbers as unique identifiers so that it is easy for you to switch from SMS and other messaging apps and retain your social graph.
label: None

sentence: We ask your permission before syncing your contacts.
label: None

sentence: We store your up-to-date contacts in order to notify you as soon as one of your contacts signs up for Telegram and to properly display names in notifications.
label: None

sentence: We only need the number and name (first and last) for this to work and store no other data about your contacts.
label: None

sentence: Our automatic algorithms can also use anonymized sets of phone numbers to calculate the average number of potential contacts an unregistered phone
label: None

sentence: number may have on Telegram.
label: None

sentence: When you open the 'Invite friends' interface, we display the resulting statistics next to your contacts to give you an idea of who could benefit most from joining Telegram.
label: None

sentence: You can always stop syncing contacts or delete them from our servers in Settings > Privacy & Security > Data Settings.
label: None

sentence: If you are using Android, Telegram will ask you for permission to access your phone call logs (READ_CALL_LOG).
label: None

sentence: If you grant this permission, Telegram will be able verify your account by transmitting a phone call instead of asking you to enter a code.
label: None

sentence: Telegram uses this permission only to confirm receipt of the confirmation call by verifying the number in the call log.
label: None

sentence: If you share a location in a chat, this location data is treated like other messages in cloud or secret chats respectively.
label: None

sentence: If you share your Live Location in any chat or turn on ’Make Myself Visible’ in People Nearby, Telegram will use your data to display your location to those users with whom you are sharing it, even when the app is closed – for as long as you keep these optional features activated.
label: None

sentence:
3.6. Cookies
The only cookies we use are those to operate and provide our Services on the web.
label: None

sentence: We do not use cookies for profiling or advertising.
label: None

sentence: The cookies we use are small text files that allow us to provide and customize our Services, and in doing so provide you with an enhanced user experience.
label: None

sentence: Your browser should allow you to control these cookies, including whether or not to accept them and how to remove them.
label: None

sentence: You may choose to block cookies with your web browser, however, if you do disable these cookies you will not be able to log in to Telegram Web.
label: None

sentence: 4. Keeping Your Personal Data Safe
label: None

sentence: If you signed up for Telegram from the UK or the EEA, your data is stored in data centers in the Netherlands.
label: None

sentence: These are third-party provided data centers in which Telegram rents a designated space.
label: None

sentence: However, the servers and networks that sit inside these data centers and on which your personal data is stored are owned by Telegram.
label: None

sentence: As such, we do not share your personal data with such data centers.
label: None

sentence: All data is stored heavily encrypted so that local Telegram engineers or physical intruders cannot get access.
label: None

sentence:
4.2. End-to-End Encrypted Data
Your messages, media and files from secret chats (see section 3.3.2 above), as well as the contents of your calls and the data you store in your Telegram Passport are processed only on your device and on the device of your recipient.
label: None

sentence: Before this data reaches our servers, it is encrypted with a key known only to you and the recipient.
label: None

sentence: While Telegram servers will handle this end-to-end encrypted data to deliver it to the recipient – or store it in the case of Telegram Passport data, we have no ways of deciphering the actual information.
label: None

sentence: In this case, we neither store nor process your personal data, rather we store and process random sequences of symbols that have no meaning without the keys which we don’t have.
label: None

sentence:
4.3. Retention
Unless stated otherwise in this Privacy Policy, the personal data that you provide us will only be stored for as long as it is necessary for us to fulfill our obligations in respect of the provision of the Services.
label: None

sentence: 5. Processing Your Personal Data
label: None

sentence:
5.1. Our Services
Telegram is a cloud service.
label: None

sentence: We will process your data to deliver your cloud chat history, including messages, media and files, to any devices of your choosing without a need for you to use third-party backups or cloud storage.
label: None

sentence: 5.2. Safety and Security
label: None

sentence: Telegram supports massive communities which we have to police against abuse and Terms of Service violations.
label: None

sentence: Telegram also has more than 400 million users which makes it a lucrative target for spammers.
label: None

sentence: To improve the security of your account, as well as to prevent spam, abuse, and other violations of our Terms of Service, we may collect metadata such as your IP address, devices and Telegram apps you've used, history of username changes, etc.
label: None

sentence: If collected, this metadata can be kept for 12 months maximum.
label: None

sentence:
5.3. Spam and Abuse
To prevent phishing, spam and other kinds of abuse and violations of Telegram’s Terms of Service, our moderators may check messages that were reported to them by their recipients.
label: None

sentence: If a spam report on a message you sent is confirmed by our moderators, your account may be limited from contacting strangers – temporarily or permanently.
label: None

sentence: You can send an appeal using @Spambot.
label: None

sentence: In case of more serious violations, your account may be banned.
label: None

sentence: We may also use automated algorithms to analyze messages in cloud chats to stop spam and phishing.
label: None

sentence: Cross-Device
label: None

sentence: Functionality
label: None

sentence: We may also store some aggregated metadata to create Telegram features (see section 5.5 below) that work across all your devices.
label: None

sentence: 5.5. Advanced features
label: None

sentence: We may use some aggregated data about how you use Telegram to build useful features.
label: None

sentence: For example, when you open the Search menu, Telegram displays the people you are more likely to message in a box at the top of the screen.
label: None

sentence: To do this, we calculate a rating that shows which people you message frequently.
label: None

sentence: To turn this feature off and delete the relevant data, go to Settings > Privacy & Security > Data Settings and disable “
label: None

5.6. No Ads
Unlike other services, we don't use your data for ad targeting or other commercial purposes.

7. Third Party Payment Services
7.1. Payment Information
The Payment Platform for Bots is available to users as of Telegram 4.0. Telegram does not process payments from users and instead relies on different payment providers around the world.

sentence: It is the payment providers that handle and store your credit card details.

7.2. Credit Card Information
When making a purchase, you enter your credit
label: None

sentence: card details into a form supplied by the payment provider that will be processing the payment, and this information goes directly to the payment provider's server.

sentence: Your credit card information never reaches Telegram's servers.

9.1. Your Rights
Under applicable data protection legislation, in certain circumstances, you have rights concerning your personal data.

label: Right to Withdraw Consent

sentence: You have a right to: (1) request a copy of all your personal data that we store and to transmit that copy to another data controller; (2) delete (see section 10 below) or amend your personal data; (3) restrict, or object to, the processing of your personal data; (4) correct any inaccurate or incomplete personal data we hold on you; and (5) lodge a complaint with national data protection authorities regarding our processing of your personal data.

sentence:
Personal data we collect
Microsoft collects data from you, through our interactions with you and through our products for a variety of purposes described below, including to operate effectively and provide you with the best experiences with our products.
label: None

sentence: You provide some of this data directly, such as when you create a Microsoft account, administer your organization’s licensing account, submit a search query to Bing, register for a Microsoft event, speak a voice command to Cortana, upload a document to OneDrive, sign up for Microsoft 365, or contact us for support.
label: None

sentence: We get some of it by collecting data about your interactions, use, and experience with our products and communications.
label: None

sentence: We rely on a variety of legal reasons and permissions (sometimes called “legal bases”) to process data, including with your consent, a balancing of legitimate interests, necessity to enter into and perform contracts, and compliance with legal obligations, for a variety of purposes described below.
label: None

sentence: We also obtain data from third parties.
label: None

sentence: We protect data obtained from third parties according to the practices described in this statement, plus any additional restrictions imposed by the source of the data.
label: None

sentence:
These third-party sources vary over time and include:

Data brokers from which we purchase demographic data to supplement the data we collect.
label: None

sentence: Services that make user-generated content from their service available to others, such as local business reviews or public social media posts.
label: None

sentence: Communication services, including email providers and social networks, when you give us permission to access your data on such
label: None

sentence: third-party services or networks.
label: None

sentence: Service providers that help us determine your device’s location.
label: None

sentence: Partners with which we offer co-branded services or engage in joint marketing activities.
label: None

sentence: Developers who create experiences through or for Microsoft products.
label: None

sentence: Third parties that deliver experiences through Microsoft products.
label: None

sentence: Publicly-available sources, such as open government databases.
label: None

sentence: If you represent an organization, such as a business or school, that utilizes Enterprise and Developer Products from Microsoft, please see the Enterprise and developer products section of this privacy statement to learn how we process your data.
label: None

sentence: If you are an end user of a Microsoft product or a Microsoft account provided by your organization, please see the Products provided by your organization and the Microsoft account sections for more information.
label: None

sentence: You have choices when it comes to the technology you use and the data you share.
label: None

sentence: When you are asked to provide personal data, you can decline.
label: None

sentence: Many of our products require some personal data to operate and provide you with a service.
label: None

sentence: If you choose not to provide data required to operate and provide you with a product or feature, you cannot use that product or feature.
label: None

sentence: Likewise, where we need to collect personal data by law or to enter into or carry out a contract with you, and you do not provide the data, we will not be able to enter into the contract;
label: None

sentence: or if this relates to an existing product you’re using, we may have to suspend or cancel it.
label: None

sentence: We will notify you if this is the case at the time.
label: None

sentence: Where providing the data is optional, and you choose not to share personal data, features like personalization that use the data will not work for you.
label: None

sentence: The data we collect depends on the context of your interactions with Microsoft and the choices you make (including your privacy settings), the products and features you use, your location, and applicable law.
label: None

sentence: The data we collect can include the following:
label: None

sentence: Name and contact data. Your first and last name, email address, postal address, phone number, and other similar contact data.
label: None

sentence: Passwords, password hints, and similar security information used for authentication and account access.
label: None

sentence: Demographic data.
label: None

sentence: Data about you such as your age, gender, country, and preferred language.
label: None

sentence: Data to process payments, such as your payment instrument number (such as a credit card number) and the security code associated with your
label: None

sentence: Subscription and licensing data.
label: None

sentence: Information about your subscriptions, licenses, and other entitlements.
label: None

sentence: Interactions.
label: None

sentence: Data about your use of Microsoft products.
label: None

sentence: In some cases, such as search queries, this is data you provide in order to make use of the products.
label: None

sentence: In other cases, such as error reports, this is data we generate.
label: None

sentence:
Other examples of interactions data include:

Device and usage data.
label: None

sentence: Data about your device and the product and features you use, including information about your hardware and software, how our products perform, as well as your settings.
label: None

sentence:
For example:
Payment and account history.
label: None

sentence: Data about the items you purchase and activities associated with your account.
label: None

sentence: Browse history.
label: None

sentence: Data about the webpages you visit.
label: None

sentence: Data about your device, your device configuration, and nearby networks.
label: None

sentence: For example, data about the operating systems and other software installed on your device, including product keys.
label: None

sentence: In addition, IP address, device identifiers (such as the IMEI number for phones), regional and language settings, and information about WLAN access points near your device.
label: None

sentence: Error reports and performance data.
label: None

sentence: Data about the performance of the products and any problems you experience, including error reports.
label: None

sentence: Error reports (sometimes called “crash dumps”)
label: None

sentence: can include details of the software or hardware related to an error, contents of files opened when an error occurred, and data about other software on your device.
label: None

sentence: Troubleshooting and help data.
label: None

sentence: Data you provide when you contact Microsoft for help, such as the products you use, and other details that help us provide support.
label: None

sentence: For example, contact or authentication data, the content of your chats and other communications with Microsoft, data about the condition of your device, and the products you use related to your help inquiry.
label: None

sentence: When you contact us, such as for customer support, phone conversations or chat sessions with our representatives may be monitored and recorded.
label: None

sentence: Interactions with third party bots and skills available through Microsoft products.
label: None

sentence: Interests and favorites.
label: None

sentence: Data about your interests and favorites, such as the sports teams you follow, the programming languages you prefer, the stocks you track, or cities you add to track things like weather or traffic.
label: None

sentence: In addition to those you explicitly provide, your interests and favorites can also be inferred or derived from other data we collect.
label: None

sentence: Information about media content (e.g., TV, video, music, audio, text books, apps, and games) you access through our products.
label: None

sentence: Searches and commands.
label: None

sentence: Search queries and commands when you use Microsoft products with search or related productivity functionality.
label: None

sentence: Your voice data, sometimes referred to as “voice clips”, such as search queries, commands, or dictation you speak, which may include background sounds.
label: None

sentence: Text, inking, and typing data and related information.
label: None

sentence: For example, when we collect inking data, we collect information about the placement of your inking instrument on your device.
label: None

sentence: Images and related information, such as picture metadata.
label: None

sentence: For example, we collect the image you provide when you use a Bing image-enabled service.
label: None

sentence: Contacts and relationships.
label: None

sentence: Data about your contacts and relationships if you use a product to share information with others, manage contacts, communicate with others, or improve your productivity.
label: None

sentence: Information about your relationships and interactions between you, other people, and organizations, such as types of engagement (e.g., likes, dislikes, events, etc.) related to people and organizations.
label: None

sentence: Data about your device’s location, which can be either precise or imprecise.
label: None

sentence: For example, we collect location data using Global Navigation Satellite
label: None

sentence: and data about nearby cell towers and Wi-Fi hotspots.
label: None

sentence: Location can also be inferred from a device’s IP address or data in your account profile that indicates where it is located with less precision, such as at a city or postal code level.
label: None

sentence: Other input.
label: None

sentence: Other inputs provided when you use our products.
label: None

sentence: For example, data such as the buttons you press on an Xbox wireless controller using the Xbox network, skeletal tracking data when you use Kinect, and other sensor data, like the number of steps you take, when you use devices that have applicable sensors.
label: None

sentence: And, if you use Spend, at your direction, we also collect financial transaction data from your credit card issuer to provide the service.
label: None

sentence: If you attend an in-store event, we collect the data you provide to us when registering for or during the event and if you enter into a prize promotion, we collect the data you input into the entry form.
label: None

sentence: Content of your files and communications you input, upload, receive, create, and control.
label: None

sentence: For example, if you transmit a file using Skype to another Skype user, we need to collect the content of that file to display it to you and the other user.
label: None

sentence: If you receive an email using Outlook.com, we need to collect the content of that email to deliver it to your inbox, display it to you, enable you to reply to it, and store it for you until you choose to delete it.
label: None

sentence:
Other content we collect when providing products to you include:

Communications, including audio, video, text (typed, inked, dictated, or otherwise), in a message, email, call, meeting request, or chat.
label: None

sentence: Photos, images, songs, movies, software, and other media or documents you store, retrieve, or otherwise process with our cloud.
label: None

sentence: Video or recordings.
label: None

sentence: Recordings of events and activities at Microsoft buildings, retail spaces, and other locations.
label: None

sentence: If you enter Microsoft Store locations or other facilities, or attend a Microsoft event that is recorded, we may process your image and voice data.
label: None

sentence: Feedback and ratings.
label: None

sentence: Information you provide to us and the content of messages you send to us, such as feedback, survey data, and product reviews you write.
label: None

sentence: Data generated through your use of Microsoft’s communications services.
label: None

sentence: Traffic data indicates with whom you have communicated and when your communications occurred.
label: None

sentence: We will process your traffic data only as required to provide, maintain, and improve our communications services and we do so with your consent.
label: None

sentence: Product-specific sections below describe data collection practices applicable to use of those products.
label: None

sentence:
How we use personal data
Microsoft uses the data we collect to provide you rich, interactive experiences.
label: None

sentence:
In particular, we use data to:

Provide our products, which includes updating, securing, and troubleshooting, as well as providing support.
label: None

sentence: It also includes sharing data, when it is required to provide the service or carry out the transactions you request.
label: None

sentence: Improve and develop our products.
label: None

sentence: Personalize our products and make recommendations.
label: None

sentence: Advertise and market to you, which includes sending promotional communications, targeting advertising, and presenting you relevant offers.
label: None

sentence: We also use the data to operate our business, which includes analyzing our performance, meeting our legal obligations, developing our workforce, and doing research.
label: None

sentence: For these purposes, we combine data we collect from different contexts (for example, from your use of two Microsoft products).
label: None

sentence: For example Cortana may use information from your calendar to suggest action items in a heads-up email, and Microsoft Store uses information about the
label: None

sentence: apps and services you use to make personalized app recommendations.
label: None

sentence: However, we have built in technological and procedural safeguards designed to prevent certain data combinations where required by law.
label: None

sentence: For example, where required by law, we store data we collect from you when you are
label: None

sentence: unauthenticated (not signed in)
label: None

sentence: separately from any account information that directly identifies you, such as your name, email address, or phone number.
label: None

sentence: Our processing of personal data for these purposes includes both automated and manual (human) methods of processing.
label: None

sentence: Our automated methods often are related to and supported by our manual methods.
label: None

sentence: For example, our automated methods include artificial intelligence (AI), which we think of as a set of technologies that enable computers to perceive, learn, reason, and assist in decision-making to solve problems in ways that are similar to what people do.
label: None

sentence: To build, train, and improve the accuracy of our automated methods of processing (including AI), we manually review some of the predictions and inferences produced by the automated methods against the underlying data from which the predictions and inferences were made.
label: None

sentence: For example, we manually review
label: None

sentence: short snippets of voice data that we have taken steps to de-identify to improve our speech recognition technologies.
label: None

sentence: This manual review may be conducted by Microsoft employees or vendors who are working on Microsoft’s behalf.
label: None

sentence: When we process personal data about you, we do so with your consent and/or as required to provide the products you use, operate our business, meet our contractual and legal obligations, protect the security of our systems and our customers, or fulfill other legitimate interests of Microsoft as described in this section and in the Reasons we share personal data section of this privacy statement.
label: None

sentence: When we transfer personal data from the European Economic Area, we do so based on a variety of legal mechanisms, as described in the Where we store and process personal data section of this privacy statement.
label: None

sentence:
More on the purposes of processing:

Provide our products.
label: None

sentence: We use data to operate our products and provide you with rich, interactive experiences.
label: None

sentence: For example, if you use OneDrive, we process the documents you upload to OneDrive to enable you to retrieve, delete, edit, forward, or otherwise process it, at your direction as part of the service.
label: None

sentence: Or, for example, if you enter a search query in the Bing search engine, we use that query to display search results to you.
label: None

sentence: Additionally, as communications are a feature of various products, programs, and activities, we use data to contact you.
label: None

sentence: For example, we may contact you by phone or email or other means to inform you when a subscription is ending or discuss your licensing account.
label: None

sentence: We also communicate with you to secure our products, for example by letting you know when product updates are available.
label: None

sentence: We use data to continually improve our products, including adding new features or capabilities.
label: None

sentence: For example, we use error reports to improve security features, search queries and clicks in Bing to improve the relevancy of the search results, usage data to determine what new features to prioritize, and voice data to develop and improve speech recognition accuracy.
label: None

sentence: Many products include personalized features, such as recommendations that enhance your productivity and enjoyment.
label: None

sentence: These features use automated processes to tailor your product experiences based on the data we have about you, such as inferences we make about you and your use of the product, activities, interests, and location.
label: None

sentence: For example, depending on your settings, if you stream movies in a browser on your Windows device, you may see a recommendation for an app from the Microsoft
label: None

sentence: Store that streams more efficiently.
label: None

sentence: If you have a Microsoft account, with your permission, we can sync your settings on several devices.
label: None

sentence: Many of our products provide controls to disable personalized features.
label: None

sentence: Product activation.
label: None

sentence: We use data—such as device and application type, location, and unique device, application, network, and subscription identifiers—to activate products that require activation.
label: None

sentence: We use data to develop new products.
label: None

sentence: For example, we use data, often de-identified, to better understand our customers’ computing and productivity needs which can shape the development of new products.
label: None

sentence: Customer support.
label: None

sentence: We use data to troubleshoot and diagnose product problems, repair customers’ devices, and provide other customer care and support services, including to help us provide, improve, and secure the quality of our products, services, and training, and to investigate security incidents.
label: None

sentence: Call recording data may also be used to authenticate or identify you based on your voice to enable Microsoft to provide support services and investigate security incidents.
label: None

sentence: Help secure and troubleshoot.
label: None

sentence: We use data to help secure and troubleshoot our products.
label: None

sentence: This includes using data to protect the security and safety of our products and customers, detecting malware and malicious activities, troubleshooting performance and compatibility issues to help customers get the most out of their experiences, and notifying customers of updates to our products.
label: None

sentence: This may include using automated systems to detect security and safety issues.
label: None

sentence: Safety.
label: None

sentence: We use data to protect the safety of our products and our customers.
label: None

sentence: Our security features and products can disrupt the operation of malicious software and notify users if malicious software is found on their devices.
label: None

sentence: For example, some of our products, such as Outlook or OneDrive, systematically scan content in an automated manner to
label: None

sentence: identify suspected spam, viruses, abusive actions, or URLs that have been flagged as fraud, phishing, or malware links;
label: None

sentence: and we reserve the right to block delivery of a communication or remove content if it violates our terms.
label: None

sentence: We use data we collect to develop product updates and security patches.
label: None

sentence: For example, we may use information about your device’s capabilities, such as available memory, to provide you a software update or security patch.
label: None

sentence: Updates and patches are intended to maximize your experience with our products, help you protect the privacy and security of your data, provide new features, and ensure your device is ready to process such updates.
label: None

sentence: Promotional communications.
label: None

sentence: We use data we collect to deliver promotional communications.
label: None

sentence: You can sign up for email subscriptions and choose whether you wish to receive promotional communications from Microsoft by email, SMS, physical mail, and telephone.
label: None

sentence: For information about managing your contact data, email subscriptions, and promotional communications, see the How to access and control your personal data section of this privacy statement.
label: None

sentence: Relevant offers.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft uses data to provide you with relevant and valuable information regarding our products.
label: None

sentence: We analyze data from a variety of sources to predict the information that will be most interesting and relevant to you and deliver such information to you in a variety of ways.
label: None

sentence: For example, we may predict your interest in gaming and communicate with you about new games you may like.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft does not use what you say in email, chat, video calls, or voice mail, or your documents, photos, or other personal files to target ads to you.
label: None

sentence: We use data we collect through our interactions with you, through some of our products, and on third-party web properties, for advertising in our products and on third-party properties.
label: None

sentence: We may use automated processes to help make advertising more relevant to you. For more information about how your data is used for advertising, see the Advertising section of this privacy statement.
label: None

sentence: Prize promotions and events.
label: None

sentence: We use your data to administer prize promotions and events available in our physical Microsoft Stores.
label: None

sentence: For example, if you enter into a prize promotion, we may use your data to select a winner and provide the prize to you if you win.
label: None

sentence: Or, if you register for a coding workshop or gaming event, we will add your name to the list of expected attendees.
label: None

sentence: Transacting commerce.
label: None

sentence: We use data to carry out your transactions with us.
label: None

sentence: For example, we process payment information to provide customers with product subscriptions and use contact information to deliver goods purchased from the Microsoft Store.
label: None

sentence: Reporting and business operations.
label: None

sentence: We use data to analyze our operations and perform business intelligence.
label: None

sentence: This enables us to make informed decisions and report on the performance of our business.
label: None

sentence: Protecting rights and property.
label: None

sentence: We use data to detect and prevent fraud, resolve disputes, enforce agreements, and protect our property.
label: None

sentence: For example, we use data to confirm the validity of software licenses to reduce piracy.
label: None

sentence: We may use automated processes to detect and prevent activities that violate our rights and the rights of others, such as fraud.
label: None

sentence: We process data to comply with law.
label: None

sentence: For example, we use the age of our customers to ensure we meet our obligations to protect children’s privacy.
label: None

sentence: We also process contact information and credentials to help customers exercise their data protection rights.
label: None

sentence: Research.
label: None

sentence: With appropriate technical and organizational measures to safeguard individuals’ rights and freedoms, we use data to conduct research, including for public interest and scientific purposes.
label: None

sentence:
Reasons we share personal data
We share your personal data with your consent or as necessary to complete any transaction or provide any product you have requested or authorized.
label: None

sentence: For example, we share your content with third parties when you tell us to do so, such as when you send an email to a friend, share photos and documents on OneDrive, or link accounts with another service.
label: None

sentence: If you use a Microsoft product provided by an organization you are affiliated with, such as an employer or school, or use an email address provided by such organization to access Microsoft products, we share certain data, such as interaction data and diagnostic data to enable your organization to manage the products.
label: None

sentence: When you provide payment data to make a purchase, we will share payment data with banks and other entities that process payment transactions or provide other financial services, and for fraud prevention and credit risk reduction.
label: None

sentence: In addition, we share personal data among Microsoft-controlled affiliates and subsidiaries.
label: None

sentence: We also share personal data with vendors or agents working on our behalf for the purposes described in this statement.
label: None

sentence: For example, companies we've hired to provide customer service support or assist in protecting and securing our systems and services may need access to personal data to provide those functions.
label: None

sentence: In such cases, these companies must abide by our data privacy and security requirements and are not allowed to use personal data they receive from us for any other purpose.
label: None

sentence: We may also disclose personal data as part of a corporate transaction such as a merger or sale of assets.
label: None

sentence:
Finally, we will retain, access, transfer, disclose, and preserve personal data, including your content (such as the content of your emails in Outlook.com, or files in private folders on OneDrive), when we have a good faith belief that doing so is necessary to do any of the following:

Comply with applicable law or respond to valid legal process, including from law enforcement or other government agencies.
label: None

sentence: Protect our customers, for example, to prevent spam or attempts to defraud users of our products, or to help prevent the loss of life or serious injury of anyone.
label: None

sentence: Operate and maintain the security of our products, including to prevent or stop an attack on our computer systems or networks.
label: None

sentence: Protect the rights or property of Microsoft, including enforcing the terms governing the use of the services—however, if we receive information indicating that someone is using our services to traffic in stolen intellectual or physical property of Microsoft, we will not inspect a customer's private content ourselves, but we may refer the matter to law enforcement.
label: None

sentence: For more information about data we disclose in response to requests from law enforcement and other government agencies, please see our Law Enforcement Requests Report.
label: None

sentence: Please note that some of our products include links to or otherwise enable you to access products of third parties whose privacy practices differ from those of Microsoft.
label: None

sentence: If you provide personal data to any of those products, your data is governed by their privacy policies.
label: None

sentence:
How to access and control your personal data
You can also make choices about the collection and use of your data by Microsoft.
label: None

sentence: You can control your personal data that Microsoft has obtained, and exercise your data protection rights, by contacting Microsoft or using various tools we provide.

sentence:
Your communications preferences

You can choose whether you wish to receive promotional communications from Microsoft by email, SMS, physical mail, and telephone.
label: None

sentence: If you receive promotional email or SMS messages from us and would like to opt out, you can do so by following the directions in that message.
label: None

sentence: You can also make choices about the receipt of promotional email, telephone calls, and postal mail by signing in with your personal Microsoft account, and viewing your communication permissions where you can update contact information, manage Microsoft-wide contact preferences, opt out of email subscriptions, and choose whether to share your contact information with Microsoft partners.
label: None

sentence: If you do not have a personal Microsoft account, you can manage your Microsoft email contact preferences by using this web form.
label: None

sentence: These choices do not apply to mandatory service communications that are part of certain Microsoft products, programs, activities, or to surveys or other informational communications that have their own unsubscribe method.
label: None

sentence:
Your advertising choices

To opt out of receiving interest-based advertising from Microsoft, visit our opt-out page.
label: None

sentence: When you opt out, your preference is stored in a cookie that is specific to the web browser you are using.
label: None

sentence: The opt-out cookie has an expiration date of five years.
label: None

sentence: If you delete the cookies on your device, you need to opt out again.
label: None

sentence: You can also link your opt-out choice with your personal Microsoft account.
label: None

sentence: It will then apply on any device where you use that account and will continue to apply until someone signs in with a different personal Microsoft account on that device.
label: None

sentence: If you delete the cookies on your device, you will need to sign in again for the settings to apply.
label: None

sentence: For Microsoft-controlled advertising that appears in apps on Windows, you may use the opt-out linked to your personal Microsoft account, or opt out of interest-based advertising by turning off the advertising ID in Windows settings.
label: None

sentence: Because the data used for interest-based advertising is also used for other required purposes (including providing our products, analytics, and fraud detection), opting out of interest-based advertising does not stop that data collection.
label: None

sentence: You will continue to get ads, although they may be less relevant to you.
label: None

sentence: You can opt out of receiving interest-based advertising from third parties we partner with by visiting their sites (see above).
label: None

Because there is not yet a common understanding of how to interpret the DNT signal, Microsoft services do not currently respond to browser DNT signals.

sentence: Cookies and similar technologies
label: None

sentence: Cookies are small text files placed on your device to store data that can be recalled by a web server in the domain that placed the cookie.
label: None

sentence: This data often consists of a string of numbers and letters that uniquely identifies your computer, but it can contain other information as well.
label: None

sentence: Some cookies are placed by third parties acting on our behalf.
label: None

sentence: We use cookies and similar technologies to store and honor your preferences and settings, enable you to sign-in, provide interest-based advertising, combat fraud, analyze how our products perform, and fulfill other legitimate purposes described below.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft apps use additional identifiers, such as the advertising ID in Windows, for similar purposes, and many of our websites and applications also contain web beacons or other similar technologies, as described below.
label: None

sentence:
Our use of cookies and similar technologies

Microsoft uses cookies and similar technologies for several purposes, depending on the context or product, including:

Storing your preferences and settings.
label: None

sentence: We use cookies to store your preferences and settings on your device, and to enhance your experiences.
label: None

sentence: For example, depending on your settings, if you enter your city or postal code to get local news or weather information on a Microsoft website, we store that data in a cookie so that you will see the relevant local information when you return to the site.
label: None

sentence: Saving your preferences with cookies, such as your preferred language, prevents you from having to set your preferences repeatedly.
label: None

sentence: If you opt out of interest-based advertising, we store your opt-out preference in a cookie on your device.
label: None

sentence: Similarly, in scenarios where we obtain your consent to place cookies on your device, we store your choice in a cookie.
label: None

sentence: Sign-in and authentication.
label: None

sentence: We use cookies to authenticate you.
label: None

sentence: When you sign in to a website using your personal Microsoft account, we store a unique ID number, and the time you signed in, in an encrypted cookie on your device.
label: None

sentence: This cookie allows you to move from page to page within the site without having to sign in again on each page.
label: None

sentence: You can also save your sign-in information so you do not have to sign in each time you return to the site.
label: None

sentence: Security.
label: None

sentence: We use cookies to process information that helps us secure our products, as well as detect fraud and abuse.
label: None

sentence: Storing information you provide to a website.
label: None

sentence: We use cookies to remember information you shared.
label: None

sentence: When you provide information to Microsoft, such as when you add products to a shopping cart on Microsoft websites, we store the data in a cookie for the purpose of remembering the information.
label: None

sentence: Some of our websites include social media cookies, including those that enable users who are signed in to the social media service to share content via that service.
label: None

sentence: Feedback.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft uses cookies to enable you to provide feedback on a website.
label: None

sentence: Interest-based advertising.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft uses cookies to collect data about your online activity and identify your interests so that we can provide advertising that is most relevant to you.
label: None

sentence: You can opt out of receiving interest-based advertising from Microsoft as described in the How to access and control your personal data section of this privacy statement.
label: None

sentence: Where required, we obtain your opt-in consent to use cookies for behavioral advertising.
label: None

sentence: Showing advertising.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft uses cookies to record how many visitors have clicked on an advertisement and to record which advertisements you have seen, for example, so you don’t see the same one repeatedly.
label: None

sentence: Analytics.
label: None

sentence: We use first- and third-party cookies and other identifiers to gather usage and performance data.
label: None

sentence: For example, we use cookies to count the number of unique visitors to a web page or service and to develop other statistics about the operations of our products.
label: None

sentence: Performance.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft uses cookies to understand and improve how our products perform.
label: None

sentence: For example, we use cookies to gather data that helps with load balancing;
label: None

sentence: this helps ensure that our websites remain up and running.
label: None

If you visit one of our websites, the site will set some or all of the following cookies:

MSCC.

sentence: Contains a country code as determined from your IP address.

label: None

label: None

sentence: This cookie identifies the advertiser, so the right ad is selected.

sentence: This cookie is used by Microsoft to reset or refresh the MUID cookie.

label: None

How to control cookies

Most web
label: None

label: None

label: None

label: None

sentence: If you use a different browser, refer to that browser’s instructions.
label: None

label: None

sentence: We separate these optional cookies by purpose, such as for advertising and social media purposes.
label: None

sentence: You may consent to certain categories of optional cookies and not others.

label: None

label: None

sentence: Certain features of Microsoft products depend on cookies.

sentence: If you choose to block cookies, you cannot sign in or use some of those features, and preferences that are dependent on cookies will be lost.

sentence: If you choose to delete cookies, any settings and preferences controlled by those cookies, including advertising preferences, are deleted and will need to be recreated.

sentence:
Our use of web beacons and analytics services

Some Microsoft webpages contain electronic tags known as web beacons that we use to help deliver cookies on our websites, count users who have visited those websites, and deliver co-branded products.
label: None

sentence: We also include web beacons or similar technologies in our electronic communications to determine whether you open and act on them.
label: None

sentence: In addition to placing web beacons on our own websites, we sometimes work with other companies to place our web beacons on their websites or in their advertisements.
label: None

sentence: This helps us to, for example, develop statistics on how often clicking on an advertisement on a Microsoft website results in a purchase or other action on the advertiser's website.
label: None

sentence: It also allows us to understand your activity on the website of a Microsoft partner in connection with your use of a Microsoft product or service.
label: None

sentence: Finally, Microsoft products often contain web beacons or similar technologies from third-party analytics providers, which help us compile aggregated statistics about the effectiveness of our promotional campaigns or other operations.
label: None

sentence: These technologies enable the analytics providers to set or read their own cookies or other identifiers on your device, through which they can collect information about your online activities across applications, websites, or other products.
label: None

sentence: However, we prohibit these analytics providers from using web beacons on our sites to collect or access information that directly identifies you (such as your name or email address
label: None

sentence: You can opt out of data collection or use by some of these analytics providers by visiting any of the following sites: Adjust, AppsFlyer, Clicktale, Flurry Analytics, Google Analytics (requires you to install a browser add-on), Kissmetrics, Mixpanel, Nielsen, Acuity Ads, WebTrends or Optimizely.
label: None

sentence:
Microsoft account
With a Microsoft account, you can sign into Microsoft products, as well as those of select Microsoft partners.
label: None

sentence: Personal data associated with your Microsoft account includes credentials, name and contact data, payment data, device and usage data, your contacts, information about your activities, and your interests and favorites.
label: None

sentence: Signing into your Microsoft account enables personalization, consistent experiences across products and devices, permits you to use cloud data storage, allows you to make payments using payment instruments stored in your Microsoft account, and enables other features.
label: None

sentence:
There are three types of Microsoft account:

When you create your own Microsoft account tied to your personal email address, we refer to that account as a personal Microsoft account.
label: None

sentence: When you or your organization (such as an employer or your school) create your Microsoft account tied to your email address provided by that organization, we refer to that account as a work or school account.
label: None

sentence: When you or your service provider (such as a cable or internet service provider) create your Microsoft account tied to your email address with your service provider’s domain, we refer to that account as a third-party account.
label: None

sentence: Personal Microsoft accounts.
label: None

sentence: The data associated with your personal Microsoft account, and how that data is used, depends on how you use the account.
label: None

sentence: Creating your Microsoft account.
label: None

sentence: When you create a personal Microsoft account, you will be asked to provide certain personal data and we will assign a unique ID number to identify your account and associated information.
label: None

sentence: While some products, such as those involving payment, require a real name, you can sign in to and use other Microsoft products without providing your real name.
label: None

sentence: Some data you provide, such as your display name, email address, and phone number, can be used to help others find and connect with you within Microsoft products.
label: None

sentence: For example, people who know your display name, email address, or phone number can use it to search for you on Skype or Microsoft Teams for personal use and send you an invite to connect with them.
label: None

sentence: Note that if you use a work or school email address to create a personal Microsoft account, your employer or school may gain access to your data.
label: None

sentence: In some cases, you will need to change the email address to a personal email address in order to continue accessing consumer-oriented products (such as the Xbox network).
label: None

sentence: Signing in to Microsoft account.
label: None

sentence: When you sign in to your Microsoft account, we create a record of your sign-in, which includes the date and time, information about the product you signed in to, your sign-in name, the unique number assigned to your account, a unique identifier assigned to your device, your IP address, and your operating system and browser version.
label: None

sentence: Signing in to Microsoft products.
label: None

sentence: Signing in to your account enables improved personalization, provides seamless and consistent experiences across products and devices, permits you to access and use cloud data storage, allows you to make payments using payment instruments stored in your Microsoft account, and enables other enhanced features and settings.
label: None

sentence: When you sign in to your account, you will stay signed in until you sign out.
label: None

sentence: If you add your Microsoft account to a Windows device (version 8 or higher), Windows will automatically sign you in to products that use Microsoft account when you access those products on that device.
label: None

sentence: When you are signed in, some products will display your name or username and your profile photo (if you have added one to your profile) as part of your use of Microsoft products, including in your communications, social interactions, and public posts.
label: None

sentence: Signing in to third-party products.
label: None

sentence: If you sign in to a third-party product with your Microsoft account, you will share data with the third party in accordance with the third party’s privacy policy.
label: None

sentence: The third party will also receive the version number assigned to your account (a new version number is assigned each time you change your sign-in data);
label: None

sentence: and information that describes whether your account has been deactivated.
label: None

sentence: If you share your profile data, the third party can display your name or user name and your profile photo (if you have added one to your profile) when you are signed in to that third-party product.
label: None

sentence: If you chose to make payments to third-party merchants using your Microsoft account, Microsoft will pass information stored in your Microsoft account to the third party or its vendors (e.g., payment processors) as necessary to process your payment and fulfill your order (such as name, credit card number, billing and shipping addresses, and relevant contact information).
label: None

sentence: The third party can use or share the data it receives when you sign in or make a purchase according to its own practices and policies.
label: None

sentence: You should carefully review the privacy statement for each product you sign in to and each merchant you purchase from to determine how it will use the data it collects.
label: None

sentence: Work or school accounts.
label: None

sentence: The data associated with a work or school account, and how it will be used, is generally similar to the use and collection of data associated with a personal Microsoft account.
label: None

sentence: If required by your organization, you will also be asked to provide a phone number or an alternative email address for additional security verification.

sentence: And, if allowed by your organization, you may also use your work or school account to sign in to Microsoft or third-party products that you acquire for yourself.

If you sign in to Microsoft products with a work or school account, note:

The owner of the domain associated with your email address may control and administer your account, and access and process your data, including the contents of your communications and files, including data stored in products provided to you by your organization, and products you acquire by yourself.

sentence: Your use of the products is subject to your organization’s policies, if any.

Collection of data from children

sentence: What is Xbox?
label: None

sentence: Xbox is the gaming and entertainment division of Microsoft.
label: None

sentence: Xbox hosts an online network that consists of software and online experiences crossing multiple platforms.
label: None

sentence: This network lets your child find and play games, view content, and connect with friends on Xbox and other gaming and social networks.
label: None

sentence: Children can connect to the Xbox network using Xbox consoles, Windows 10 PCs, and mobile devices (Android and iPhone).
label: None

sentence: Xbox consoles are devices your child can use to find and play games, movies, music, and other digital entertainment.
label: None

sentence: When they sign in to Xbox, in apps, games or on a console, we assign a unique device identifier.
label: None

sentence: For instance, when their Xbox console is connected to the internet and they sign in to the console, we identify which console and which version of the console’s operating system they are using.
label: None

sentence: Xbox continues to provide new experiences in client apps that are connected to and backed by services such as Xbox network and cloud gaming.
label: None

label: None

sentence:
We collect information about your child’s use of Xbox services, games, apps, and consoles including:

When they sign in and sign out of Xbox, the games they play and apps they use, their game progress, achievements, and play statistics, purchase history, and content they obtain.
label: None

sentence: Performance data about Xbox consoles, Xbox Game Pass and other Xbox apps, the Xbox network, connected devices, and network connection, including software or hardware errors.

sentence: Content they add, upload, or share through the Xbox network, including text, pictures, and video they capture in games and apps.

sentence: Social activity, including chat data and interactions with other gamers, and connections they make (friends they add and people who follow them) on the Xbox network.

sentence: If your child uses an Xbox console or
label: None

sentence: Xbox app on another device capable of accessing the Xbox network, and that device includes a storage device (hard drive or memory unit), usage data will be stored on the storage device and sent to Microsoft the next time they sign in to Xbox, even if they have been playing offline.

sentence: Any player in a multiplayer game session can record video (game clips) and capture screenshots of their view of the game play.

sentence: This data may also be used to provide a safe gaming environment and enforce the Community Standards for Xbox.
