sentence:
Other important privacy information
Below you will find additional privacy information, such as how we secure your data, where we process your data, and how long we retain your data.
label: None

sentence: You can find more information on Microsoft and our commitment to protecting your privacy at Microsoft Privacy.
label: None

sentence:
Security of personal data
Microsoft is committed to protecting the security of your personal data.
label: None

sentence: We use a variety of security technologies and procedures to help protect your personal data from unauthorized access, use, or disclosure.
label: None

sentence: For example, we store the personal data you provide on computer systems that have limited access and are in controlled facilities.
label: None

sentence: When we transmit highly confidential data (such as a credit card number or password) over the internet, we protect it through the use of encryption.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft complies with applicable data protection laws, including applicable security breach notification laws.
label: None

sentence: Where we store and process personal data
label: None

sentence: Personal data collected by Microsoft may be stored and processed in your region, in the United States, and in any other country where Microsoft or its affiliates, subsidiaries, or service providers operate facilities.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft maintains major data centers in Australia, Austria, Brazil, Canada, Chile, Finland, France, Germany, Hong Kong, India, Ireland, Japan, Korea, Luxembourg, Malaysia, the Netherlands, Singapore, South Africa, the United Kingdom, and the United States.
label: None

sentence: Typically, the primary storage location is in the customer’s region or in the United States, often with a backup to a data center in another region.
label: None

sentence: The storage location(s)
label: None

sentence: are chosen in order to operate efficiently, to improve performance, and to create redundancies in order to protect the data in the event of an outage or other problem.
label: None

sentence: We take steps to ensure that the data we collect under this privacy statement is processed according to the provisions of this statement and the requirements of applicable law wherever the data is located.
label: None

sentence: We transfer personal data from the European Economic Area, the United Kingdom, and Switzerland to other countries, some of which have not yet been determined by the European Commission to have an adequate level of data protection.
label: None

sentence: For example, their laws may not guarantee you the same rights, or there may not be a privacy supervisory authority there that is capable of addressing your complaints.
label: None

sentence: When we engage in such transfers, we use a variety of legal mechanisms, including contracts such as the standard contractual clauses published by the European Commission under Commission Decision 2004/915/EC, to help ensure your rights and protections travel with your data.
label: None

sentence: To learn more about the European Commission’s decisions on the adequacy of the protection of personal data in the countries where Microsoft processes personal data, see this article on the European Commission website.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft Corporation complies with the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield Framework and Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield Framework as set forth by the U.S. Department of Commerce regarding the collection, use, and retention of personal information transferred from the European Union, the United Kingdom, and Switzerland to the United States, although Microsoft does not rely on the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield Framework as a legal basis for transfers of personal data in light of the judgment of the Court of Justice of the EU in Case C-311/18. Microsoft Corporation has certified to the Department of Commerce that it adheres to the Privacy Shield Principles.
label: None

sentence: If third-party agents process personal data on our behalf in a manner inconsistent with the principles of either Privacy Shield framework, we remain liable unless we prove we are not responsible for the event giving rise to the damage.
label: None

sentence: The controlled U.S. subsidiaries of Microsoft Corporation, as identified in our self-certification submission, also adhere to the Privacy Shield Principles—for more info, see the list of Microsoft U.S. entities or subsidiaries adhering to the Privacy Shield Principles.
label: None

sentence: If there is any conflict between the terms in this privacy policy and the Privacy Shield Principles, the Privacy Shield Principles shall govern.
label: None

sentence: To learn more about the Privacy Shield program, and to view our certification, visit the Privacy Shield website.
label: None

sentence: If you have a question or complaint related to participation by Microsoft in the EU-U.S. or
label: None

sentence: Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield, we encourage you to contact us via our web
label: None

sentence: For any complaints related to the Privacy Shield frameworks that Microsoft cannot resolve directly, we have chosen to cooperate with the relevant
label: None

sentence: EU Data Protection Authority, or a panel established by the European data protection authorities, for resolving disputes with EU individuals, and with the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC) for resolving disputes with Swiss individuals.
label: None

sentence: Please contact us if you’d like us to direct you to your data protection authority contacts.
label: None

sentence: As further explained in the Privacy Shield Principles, binding arbitration is available to address residual complaints not resolved by other means.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft is subject to the investigatory and enforcement powers of the U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC).
label: None

sentence:
Our retention of personal data
Microsoft retains personal data for as long as necessary to provide the products and fulfill the transactions you have requested, or for other legitimate purposes
label: None

sentence: such as complying with our legal obligations, resolving disputes, and enforcing our agreements.
label: None

sentence: Because these needs can vary for different data types, the context of our interactions with you or your use of products, actual retention periods can vary significantly.
label: None

sentence: Other criteria used to determine the retention periods include:
label: None

sentence: Do customers provide, create, or maintain the data with the expectation we will retain it until they affirmatively remove it?
label: None

sentence: Examples include a document you store in OneDrive, or an email message you keep in your Outlook.com inbox.
label: None

sentence: In such cases, we would aim to maintain the data until you actively delete it, such as by moving an email from your Outlook.com inbox to the Deleted Items folder, and then emptying that folder (when your Deleted Items folder is emptied, those emptied items remain in our system for up to 30 days before final deletion).
label: None

sentence: (Note that there may be other reasons why the data has to be deleted sooner, for example if you exceed limits on how much data can be stored in your account.)
label: None

sentence: Is there an automated control, such as in the Microsoft privacy dashboard, that enables the customer to access and delete the personal data at any time?
label: None

sentence: If there is not, a shortened data retention time will generally be adopted.
label: None

sentence: Is the personal data of a sensitive type?
label: None

sentence: If so, a shortened retention time would generally be adopted.
label: None

sentence: Has Microsoft adopted and announced a specific retention period for a certain data type?
label: None

sentence: For example, for Bing search queries, we de-identify stored queries by removing the entirety of the IP address after 6 months, and cookie IDs and other cross-session identifiers that are used to identify a particular account or device after 18 months.
label: None

sentence: Has the user provided consent for a longer retention period?
label: None

sentence: If so, we will retain data in accordance with your consent.
label: None

sentence: Is Microsoft subject to a legal, contractual, or similar obligation to retain or delete the data?
label: None

sentence: Examples can include mandatory data retention laws in the applicable jurisdiction, government orders to preserve data relevant to an investigation, or data retained for the purposes of litigation.
label: None

sentence: Conversely, if we are required by law to remove unlawful content, we will do so.
label: None

Advertising

label: None

Microsoft offers preview, insider, beta or other free-of-charge products and features ("previews") to enable you to evaluate them while providing Microsoft with data about your use of the product, including feedback and device and usage data.
label: None

sentence: As a result, previews can automatically collect additional data, provide fewer controls, and otherwise employ different privacy and security measures than those typically present in our products.
label: None

sentence: If you participate in previews, we may contact you about your feedback or your interest in continuing to use the product after general release.
label: None

sentence: Changes to this privacy statement
label: None

sentence:
We update this privacy statement when necessary to provide greater transparency or in response to:

Feedback from customer, regulators, industry, or other stakeholders.
label: None

sentence: Changes in our products.
label: None

sentence: Changes in our data processing activities or policies.
label: None

sentence: When we post changes to this statement, we will revise the "last updated" date at the top of the statement and describe the changes on the Change history page.
label: None

sentence: If there are material changes to the statement, such as a change to the purposes of processing of personal data that is not consistent with the purpose for which it was originally collected, we will notify you either by prominently posting a notice of such changes before they take effect or by directly sending you a notification.
label: None

sentence: We encourage you to periodically review this privacy statement to learn how Microsoft is protecting your information.
label: None

sentence: How to contact us
label: None

sentence: If you have a privacy concern, complaint, or question for the Microsoft Chief Privacy Officer or the Data Protection Officer for your region, please contact us by using our web form.
label: None

sentence: We will respond to questions or concerns as required by law and within a period no longer than 30 days.
label: None

sentence: You can also raise a concern or lodge a complaint with a data protection authority or other official with jurisdiction.
label: None

sentence: When Microsoft is a controller, unless otherwise stated, Microsoft Corporation and, for those in the European Economic Area, the United Kingdom, and Switzerland, Microsoft Ireland Operations Limited are the data controllers for personal data
label: None

sentence: we collect through the products subject to this statement.
label: None

sentence:
Our addresses are:

Microsoft Privacy, Microsoft Corporation, One Microsoft Way, Redmond, Washington 98052, USA.
label: None

sentence: Telephone: +1 (425) 882
label: None

sentence: Microsoft Ireland Operations Limited, Attn: Data Protection Officer, One Microsoft Place, South County Business Park, Leopardstown, Dublin 18, Ireland.
label: None

sentence: To find the Microsoft subsidiary in your country or region, see the list of Microsoft office locations around the world.
label: None

sentence:
If you would like to exercise your rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act, you may contact Microsoft at the address above, use our web form, or call our US toll free number 1.844.931.2038.

Where French law applies, you can also send us specific instructions regarding the use of your personal data after your death, by using our web
label: None

sentence: If you have a technical or support question, please visit Microsoft Support to learn more about Microsoft Support offerings.
label: None

sentence: If you have a personal Microsoft account password question, please visit Microsoft account support.
label: None

sentence:
Product-specific details:
Enterprise and developer products
Enterprise and Developer Products are Microsoft products and related software offered to and designed primarily for use by organizations and developers.
label: None

sentence:
They include:

Cloud services, referred to as Online Services in the Microsoft Online Services Terms (OST), such as Microsoft 365 and Office 365, Microsoft Azure, Microsoft Dynamics365, and Microsoft Intune for which an organization (our customer) contracts with Microsoft for the services (“Enterprise Online Services”).
label: None

sentence: Other enterprise and developer tools and cloud-based services, such as Azure PlayFab Services (to learn more see Azure PlayFab Terms of Service).
label: None

sentence: Server, developer, and hybrid cloud platform products, such as Windows Server, SQL Server, Visual Studio, System Center, Azure Stack and open source software like Bot Framework solutions (“Enterprise and Developer Software”).
label: None

sentence: Appliances and hardware used for storage infrastructure, such as StorSimple (“Enterprise Appliances”).
label: None

sentence: Professional services referred to in the OST that are available with Enterprise Online Services, such as onboarding services, data migration services, data science services, or services to supplement existing features in the Enterprise Online Services.
label: None

sentence: In the event of a conflict between this Microsoft privacy statement and the terms of any agreement(s) between a customer and Microsoft for Enterprise and Developer Products, the terms of those agreement(s) will control.
label: None

sentence: You can also learn more about our Enterprise and Developer Products’ features and settings, including choices that impact your privacy or your end users’ privacy, in product documentation.
label: None

sentence: If any of the terms below are not defined in this Privacy Statement or the OST, they have the definitions below.
label: None

sentence: When a customer tries, purchases, uses, or subscribes to Enterprise and Developer Products, or obtains support for or professional services with such products, Microsoft receives data from you and collects and generates data to provide the service (including improving, securing, and updating the service), conduct our legitimate business operations, and communicate with the customer.
label: None

sentence:
For example:

When a customer engages with a Microsoft sales representative, we collect the customer’s name and contact data, along with information about the customer’s organization, to support that engagement.
label: None

sentence: When a customer interacts with a Microsoft support professional, we collect device and usage data or error reports to diagnose and resolve problems.
label: None

sentence: When a customer pays for products, we collect contact and payment data to process the payment.
label: None

sentence: When Microsoft sends communications to a customer, we use data to personalize the content of the communication.
label: None

sentence: When a customer engages with Microsoft for professional services, we collect the name and contact data of the customer’s designated point of contact and use information provided by the customer to perform the services that the customer has requested.
label: None

sentence: The Enterprise and Developer Products enable you to purchase, subscribe to, or use other products and online services from Microsoft or third parties with different privacy practices, and those other products and online services are governed by their respective privacy statements and policies.
label: None

sentence:
Enterprise online services
To provide the Enterprise Online Services, Microsoft uses data you provide (including Customer Data, Personal Data, Administrator Data, Payment Data, and Support Data) and data Microsoft collects or generates associated with your use of the Enterprise Online Services.
label: None

sentence: We process data as described in the Online Services Terms (OST), Online Services Data Protection Addendum (Online Services DPA) and the Microsoft Trust Center.
label: None

sentence: Customer is the controller of Personal Data and Microsoft is the processor of such data, except when (a) Customer acts as a processor of Personal Data, in which case Microsoft is a subprocessor or (b) as stated otherwise in the standard Online Services DPA.
label: None

sentence: In addition, as provided in the standard Online
label: None

sentence: Services DPA, Microsoft has taken on the added responsibilities of a data controller under GDPR when processing Personal Data in connection with its legitimate business operations incident to providing its services to Microsoft’s commercial customers, such as billing and preparing invoices;
label: None

sentence: financial reporting; business planning and product strategy; improving core functionality for accessibility, privacy, and energy efficiency; and combatting fraud, cybercrime, and cyberattacks on Microsoft products.
label: None

sentence: We use Personal Data in the least identifiable form that will support processing necessary for these legitimate business operations.
label: None

sentence: We generally aggregate Personal Data before using it for our legitimate business operations, removing the ability to identify specific individuals.
label: None

sentence: Administrator Data is the information provided to Microsoft during sign-up, purchase, or administration of Enterprise Online Services.
label: None

sentence: We use Administrator Data to provide the Enterprise Online Services, complete transactions, service the account, detect and prevent fraud, and comply with our legal obligations.
label: None

sentence: Administrator Data includes the name, address, phone number, and email address you provide, as well as aggregated usage data related to your account, such as the controls you select.
label: None

sentence: Administrator Data also includes contact information of your colleagues and friends if you agree to provide it to Microsoft for the limited purpose of sending them an invitation to use the Enterprise Online Services;
label: None

sentence: we contact those individuals with communications that include information about you, such as your name and profile photo.
label: None

sentence: As needed, we use Administrator Data to contact you to provide information about your account, subscriptions, billing, and updates to the Enterprise Online Services, including information about new features, security, or other technical issues.
label: None

sentence: We also contact you regarding third-party inquiries we receive regarding use of the Enterprise Online Services, as described in your agreement.
label: None

sentence: You cannot unsubscribe from these non-promotional communications.
label: None

sentence: We may also contact you regarding information and offers about other products and services, or share your contact information with Microsoft's partners.
label: None

sentence: When such a partner has specific services or solutions to meet your needs, or to optimize your use of the Enterprise Online Services, we may share limited, aggregated information about your organization’s account with the partner.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft will not share your confidential information or contact information with the authorized partner unless we have sufficient rights to do so.
label: None

sentence: You can manage your contact preferences or update your information in your account profile.
label: None

sentence: We use payment data to complete transactions, as well as to detect and prevent fraud.
label: None

sentence: Customers provide or authorize Microsoft to collect data in connection with obtaining technical support for the Enterprise Online Services.
label: None

sentence: We process Support Data to provide technical support and as described in the Online
label: None

sentence: Services DPA.
label: None

sentence: Local Software and Diagnostic Data.
label: None

sentence: Online Services may require, or may be enhanced by, the installation of local software (e.g., agents, device management applications).
label: None

sentence: The local software may collect Diagnostic Data (as defined in the Online
label: None

sentence: Services DPA) about the use and performance of that software.
label: None

sentence: That data may be transmitted to Microsoft and used for the purposes described in the Online
label: None

sentence: Services DPA.
label: None

sentence: Bing Search Services Data.
label: None

sentence: Bing Search Services, as defined in the OST, use data such as search queries as described in the Bing section of this privacy statement.
label: None

sentence:
Enterprise and developer software and enterprise appliances
Enterprise and developer software and enterprise appliances collect data to operate effectively and provide you the best experiences.
label: None

sentence: The data we collect depends on the features you use, as well as your configuration and settings, but it is generally limited to device and usage data.
label: None

sentence: Customers have choices about the data they provide.
label: None

sentence:
Here are examples of the data we collect:

During installation or when you upgrade an enterprise and developer software, we may collect device and usage data to learn whether you experience any difficulties.
label: None

sentence: When you use enterprise software or enterprise appliances, we may collect device and usage data to learn about your operating environment to improve security features.
label: None

sentence: When you experience a crash using enterprise software or enterprise appliances, you may choose to send Microsoft an error report to help us diagnose the problem and deliver customer support.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft uses the data we collect from enterprise and developer software and enterprise appliances to provide and improve our products, to deliver customer support, to activate the product, to communicate with you, and to operate our business.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft SQL Server is a relational database management platform and includes products that can be installed separately (such as SQL Server Management Studio).
label: None

sentence: For detailed information about what data we collect, how we use it, and how to manage your privacy options, visit the SQL Server privacy page.
label: None

sentence: If you work in an organization, your administrator can set certain telemetry settings in SQL Server via Group Policy.
label: None

sentence: HoloLens headsets are self-contained
label: None

sentence: Windows computers with Wi-Fi connectivity that enable a mixed reality experience for apps and solutions.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft collects diagnostic data to solve problems and to keep Windows running on HoloLens up to date, secure, and operating properly.
label: None

sentence: Diagnostic data also helps us improve HoloLens and related Microsoft products and services depending on the diagnostic data settings you’ve chosen for your device.
label: None

sentence: Learn more about Windows diagnostic data.
label: None

sentence: HoloLens also processes and collects data related to the HoloLens experience and device, which include cameras, microphones, and infrared sensors that enable motions and voice to navigate.
label: None

sentence: If you choose, cameras can be used to sign you in automatically using your iris.
label: None

sentence: To do this, HoloLens takes an image of your iris and measures distances between key points to create and store a numeric value that represents only you.
label: None

sentence: This data stays on the HoloLens and is not shared with anyone, and you can choose to delete this data from your HoloLens at any time.
label: None

sentence: HoloLens also detects hand
label: None

sentence: gestures intended for system interactions (such as menu navigation, pan/zoom, and scroll).
label: None

sentence: This data is processed on your HoloLens device and is not stored.
label: None

sentence: HoloLens derives tracking points based on your environment which allows it to understand surfaces in space and allows you to place digital assets on them.
label: None

sentence: There are no images associated with this environmental data and it is stored locally on the HoloLens device.
label: None

sentence: You can choose to delete this data from your HoloLens at any time.
label: None

sentence: The headset's microphones enable voice commands for navigation, controlling apps, or to enter search terms.
label: None

sentence:
Productivity and communications products
Productivity and communications products are applications, software, and services you can use to create, store, and share documents, as well as communicate with others.
label: None

sentence:
Microsoft 365
Microsoft 365, previous versions called Office 365, is a collection of productivity services and Office applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook, among others.
label: None

sentence: For more details about Outlook, see the Outlook section of this privacy statement.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft 365 is a service that is comprised of client software applications and connected online services that span many platforms and have numerous interdependent experiences.
label: None

sentence: Various Microsoft 365 services enable you to use your file content for designs and recommendations, collaborate with others within your documents, and provide you functionality from other Microsoft products, such as Bing and Cortana, and third-party connected products.
label: None

sentence: If you work in an organization, your administrator may turn off or disable these connected services.
label: None

sentence: You can access the privacy controls within your Office apps by selecting File > Account > Account Privacy.
label: None

sentence: Account Privacy Settings for more information.
label: None

sentence: Office Roaming Service.
label: None

sentence: The Office Roaming Service helps keep your Microsoft 365 settings up to date across your devices running Microsoft 365. When you sign in to Microsoft 365 with your Microsoft account or an account issued by your organization, the Office Client Policy Service is turned on and syncs some of your customized Microsoft 365 settings to Microsoft servers (such as a list of most recently used documents and the last location viewed within a document).
label: None

sentence: When you sign in to Microsoft 365 on another device with the same account, the Office Roaming Service downloads your settings from Microsoft servers and applies them to the additional device.
label: None

sentence: The Office Roaming Service also applies some of your customized Microsoft 365 settings when you sign in to Office.com.
label: None

sentence: When you sign out of Microsoft 365, the Office Roaming Service removes your Microsoft 365 settings from your device.
label: None

sentence: Any changes you make to your customized Microsoft 365 settings are sent to Microsoft servers.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft Updates.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft uses services such
label: None

sentence: as Click-to-Run or Microsoft
label: None

sentence: AutoUpdate to provide you with security and other important updates.
label: None

sentence: Click-to-Run Update Service.
label: None

sentence: The Click-to-Run Update
label: None

sentence: Service allows you to install certain Microsoft 365 products over the internet.
label: None

sentence: The Click-to-Run Update Service also automatically detects online
label: None

sentence: updates to Click-to-Run-enabled products on your device and downloads and installs them automatically.
label: None

sentence: Translator used in Office apps is designed as a no-trace connected experience.
label: None

sentence: With no trace connected experience, no portion of your translation request that gets sent to Microsoft Translator API service will be logged, your submitted text will not be used to improve the quality of the Microsoft Translator service, and there will not be any record of any portion of your data retained by Microsoft.
label: None

sentence: Diagnostic data is used to (i) keep your Office apps secure and up to date; (ii) detect, diagnose, and remediate problems;
label: None

sentence: and (iii) make product improvements.
label: None

sentence: This data does not include a user's name or email address, the content of the user's files, or information about apps unrelated to Office.
label: None

sentence: Users have a choice between two different levels of diagnostic data collection, Required and Optional.
label: None

sentence: Required.
label: None

sentence: The minimum data necessary to help keep Office apps secure, up to date, and performing as expected on the device it's installed on.
label: None

sentence: Optional.
label: None

sentence: Additional data that helps us make product improvements and provides enhanced information to help us detect, diagnose, and remediate issues.
label: None

sentence: See Diagnostic Data in Office for more information.
label: None

sentence: Connected Experiences.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft 365 continues to provide more experiences in client applications that are connected to and backed by cloud-based services.
label: None

sentence: If you choose to use connected experiences, required service data will be collected to ensure that all these connected experiences will be reliable, up to date, remain secure, and perform as expected.
label: None

sentence: See below for additional information about required service data.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft 365 consists of client software applications and connected experiences designed to enable you to create, communicate, and collaborate more effectively.
label: None

sentence: Working with others on a document stored on OneDrive for Business or translating the contents of a Word document into a different language are examples of connected experiences.
label: None

sentence: There are two types of connected experiences.
label: None

sentence: Experiences that analyze your content.
label: None

sentence: Experiences that use your Office content to provide you with design recommendations, editing suggestions, data insights, and similar features.
label: None

sentence: For example, PowerPoint Designer or Editor in Word.
label: None

sentence: Experiences that download online content.
label: None

sentence: Experiences that allow you to search and download online content including templates, images, 3D models, videos, and reference materials to enhance your documents.
label: None

sentence: For example, templates or PowerPoint QuickStarter.
label: None

sentence: You can access the privacy controls within your Office apps by selecting File > Account > Account Privacy.
label: None

sentence: These privacy settings allow you to configure your connected experiences.
label: None

sentence: For example, you can choose to enable connected experiences that download online content, but not connected experiences that analyze content.
label: None

sentence: Turning off connected experiences will also turn off additional experiences, such as document co-authoring and online file storage.
label: None

sentence: But even if you use this privacy setting to turn off connected experiences, certain functionality will remain available, such as syncing your mailbox in Outlook, as well as essential services described below.
label: None

sentence: If you choose to disable certain types of connected experiences, either the ribbon or menu command for those connected experiences will be grayed out or
label: None

sentence: you will get an error message when you try to use those connected experiences.
label: None

sentence: There are a set of services that are essential to how Microsoft 365 functions and cannot be disabled.
label: None

sentence: For example, the licensing service that confirms that you are properly licensed to use Microsoft 365 is essential.
label: None

sentence: Required service data about these services is collected and sent to Microsoft, regardless of any other settings that you have configured.
label: None

sentence: See Essential Services for more information.
label: None

sentence: Required service data for connected experiences.
label: None

sentence: As you use a connected experience, data is sent to and processed by Microsoft to provide you that connected experience.
label: None

sentence: This data is necessary because this information enables us to deliver these cloud-based connected experiences.
label: None

sentence: We refer to this data as required service data.
label: None

sentence: Required service data can include information related to the operation of the connected experience that is needed to keep the underlying service secure, up to date, and performing as expected.
label: None

sentence: If you choose to use a connected experience that analyzes your content, for example Translate in Word, the text you typed and selected to translate is also sent and processed to provide you the connected experience.
label: None

sentence: Your text and the translation are not stored by our service.
label: None

sentence: Required service data can also include information needed by a connected experience to perform its task, such as configuration information about the Office app.
label: None

sentence: See Required service data for Office for more information.
label: None

sentence:
Microsoft Teams
This section applies to the consumer offering of Teams;
label: None

sentence: if you are using Teams with a school or work account, see the Enterprise and developer products of this privacy statement.
label: None

sentence: Teams is an all-in-one collaboration and communication hub.
label: None

sentence: Teams lets you stay organised and connected across your entire life.
label: None

sentence: Teams allows you to call people with voice or video calling.
label: None

sentence: Teams allows you to easily find people, files, photos, conversations, tasks, and calendars in one convenient and secure place.
label: None

sentence: Teams allows you to store confidential information like passwords, rewards numbers, or login information and share it with others within Teams.
label: None

sentence: With your consent, you can share your location with friends and family.
label: None

sentence: As part of providing these features, Microsoft collects data about the usage of the features as well as information about your communications, including the time and date of the communication and users that are part of the communication.
label: None

sentence: Teams profile.
label: None

sentence: Your Teams profile includes information you provided when you set up a Microsoft account.
label: None

sentence: To enable other people to find you on Teams (or products that interact with Teams for personal use, including Teams for enterprise) your display name and picture are visible to other users on Teams that have your contact information.
label: None

sentence: Teams contacts.
label: None

sentence: With your permission, Teams will sync your device contacts periodically and check for other Teams users that match contacts in your device’s address book.
label: None

sentence: You are always in control of your contacts and can stop syncing at any time.
label: None

sentence: If you choose to stop syncing your device contacts, any device contacts that have not been matched during the synchronization process will be deleted from Teams.
label: None

sentence: If you wish to invite any of your device contacts to join a conversation, you can invite users to a 1:1 directly, or Microsoft can send an invitation on your behalf via SMS or email for invitations to group conversations.
label: None

sentence: You can block users if you don’t want to receive their communications; additionally you can report a concern to Microsoft.
label: None

sentence: Location sharing.
label: None

sentence: You can share your static or live location with individuals or groups within Teams.
label: None

sentence: You are in control and can stop sharing at any time.
label: None

sentence: Sharing location for children is permitted with parental consent and in groups where an adult from the Microsoft family group is present.
label: None

sentence: Push notifications.
label: None

sentence: To let you know of incoming calls, chats, and other messages, Teams uses the notification service on your device.
label: None

sentence: For many devices, these services are provided by another company.
label: None

sentence: To tell you who is calling, for example, or to give you the first few words of the new chat, Teams has to tell the notification service so that they can provide the notification to you.
label: None

sentence: The company providing the notification service on your device will use this information in accordance with their own terms and privacy policy.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft is not responsible for the data collected by the company providing the notification service.
label: None

sentence: If you don’t want to use the notification services for incoming Teams calls and messages, turn it off in the settings found on your device.
label: None

sentence:
OneDrive
OneDrive lets you store and access your files on virtually any device.
label: None

sentence: You can also share and collaborate on your files with others.
label: None

sentence: Some versions of the OneDrive application enable you to access both your personal OneDrive by signing in with your personal Microsoft account and your OneDrive for Business by signing in with your work or school Microsoft account as part of your organization's use of Microsoft 365
label: None

sentence: or Office 365.
label: None

sentence: When you use OneDrive, we collect data about your usage of the service, as well as the content you store, to provide, improve, and protect the services.
label: None

sentence: Examples include indexing the contents of your OneDrive documents so that you can search for them later and using location information to enable you to search for photos based on where the photo was taken.
label: None

sentence: We also collect device information so we can deliver personalized experiences, such as enabling you to sync content across devices and roam customized settings.
label: None

sentence: When you store content in OneDrive, that content will inherit the sharing permissions of the folder in which you store it.
label: None

sentence: For example, if you decide to store content in the public folder, the content will be public and available to anyone on the internet who can find the folder.
label: None

sentence: If you store content in a private folder, the content will be private.
label: None

sentence: When you share content to a social network like Facebook from a device that you have synced with your OneDrive account, your content is either uploaded to that social network, or a link to that content is posted to that social network.
label: None

sentence: Doing this makes the content accessible to anyone on that social network.
label: None

sentence: To delete the content, you need to delete it from the social network (if it was uploaded there, rather than a link to it) and from OneDrive.
label: None

sentence: When you share your OneDrive content with your friends via a link, an email with the link is sent to those friends.
label: None

sentence: The link contains an authorization code that allows anyone with the link to access your content.
label: None

sentence: If one of your friends sends the link to other people, they will also be able to access your content, even if you did not choose to share the content with them.
label: None

sentence: To revoke permissions for your content on OneDrive, sign in to your account and then select the specific content to manage the permission levels.
label: None

sentence: Revoking permissions for a link effectively deactivates the link.
label: None

sentence: No one will be able to use the link to access the content unless you decide to share the link again.
label: None

sentence: Files managed with OneDrive for Business are stored separately from files stored with your personal OneDrive.
label: None

sentence: OneDrive for Business collects and transmits personal data for authentication, such as your email address and password, which will be transmitted to Microsoft and/or to the provider of your Microsoft 365 or Office 365 service.
label: None

sentence:
Outlook
Outlook products are designed to improve your productivity through improved communications and include Outlook.com, Outlook applications, and related services.
label: None

sentence: Outlook.com.
label: None

sentence: Outlook.com is the primary consumer email service from Microsoft and includes email accounts with addresses that end in outlook.com, live.com, hotmail.com, and msn.com.
label: None

sentence: Outlook.com provides features that let you connect with your friends on social networks.
label: None

sentence: You will need to create a Microsoft account to use Outlook.com.
label: None

sentence: When you delete an email or item from a mailbox in Outlook.com, the item generally goes into your Deleted Items folder where it remains for approximately 7 days unless you move it back to your inbox, you empty the folder, or the service empties the folder automatically, whichever comes first.
label: None

sentence: When the Deleted Items folder is emptied, those emptied items remain in our system for up to 30 days before final deletion, unless we are legally required to retain the data for longer.
label: None

sentence: Outlook applications.
label: None

sentence: Outlook client applications are software you install on your device that permits you to manage email, calendar items, files, contacts, and other data from email, file storage, and other services, like Exchange Online or Outlook.com, or servers, like Microsoft Exchange.
label: None

sentence: You can use multiple accounts from different providers, including third-party providers, with Outlook applications.
label: None

sentence: To add an account, you must provide permission for Outlook to access data from the email or file storage services.
label: None

sentence: When you add an account to Outlook, your mail, calendar items, files, contacts, settings and other data from that account will automatically sync to your device.
label: None

sentence: If you are using the mobile Outlook application, that data will also sync to Microsoft servers to enable additional features such
label: None

sentence: as faster search, personalized filtering of less important mail, and an ability to add email attachments from linked file storage providers without leaving the Outlook application.
label: None

sentence: If you are using the desktop Outlook application, you can choose whether to allow the data to sync to our servers.
label: None

sentence: At any time, you can remove an account or make changes to the data that is synced from your account.
label: None

sentence: If you add an account provided by an organization (such as your employer or school), the owner of the organizational domain can implement policies and controls (for example, requiring multi-factor authentication or the ability to remotely wipe data from your device) that can affect your use of Outlook.
label: None

sentence: To learn more about the data the Outlook applications collect and process, please see the Microsoft 365 section of this privacy statement.
label: None

sentence:
Skype
Skype lets you send and receive voice, video, SMS, and instant message communications.
label: None

sentence: This section applies to the consumer version of Skype;
label: None

sentence: if you are using Skype for Business, see the Enterprise and developer products section of this privacy statement.
label: None

sentence: As part of providing these features, Microsoft collects usage data about your communications that includes the time and date of the communication and the numbers or user names that are part of the communication.
label: None

sentence: Your Skype profile includes information you provided when you set up a Microsoft account.
label: None

sentence: To enable other people to find you on Skype (or products that interact with Skype, such as Skype for Business), depending on your profile settings, your Skype profile is included in the Skype public search.
label: None

sentence: Your profile includes your user name, avatar, and any other data you choose to add to your profile or display to others.
label: None

sentence: Skype Contacts.
label: None

sentence: If you use a Microsoft service, such as Outlook.com, to manage contacts, Skype will automatically add the people you know to your Skype contact list until you tell the application to stop.
label: None

sentence: With your permission, Skype will also check your device to automatically add your friends as Skype contacts.
label: None

sentence: You can block users if you don’t want to receive their communications.
label: None

sentence: Partner companies. To make Skype available to more people, we partner with other companies to allow Skype to be offered via those companies’ services.
label: None

sentence: If you use Skype through a company other than Microsoft, that company’s privacy policy governs how it handles your data.
label: None

sentence: To comply with applicable law or respond to valid legal process, or to help our partner company or local operator comply or respond, we may access, transfer, disclose, and preserve your data.
label: None

sentence:
Microsoft Translator
Microsoft Translator is a machine translation system and service designed to automatically translate text and voice input between numerous supported languages.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft Translator is made available as a stand-alone consumer app for Android, iOS, and Windows and its service capabilities
label: None

sentence: are also integrated in a variety of Microsoft products and services, such as Translator Hub, Translator for Bing, and Translator for Microsoft Edge.

sentence: Microsoft Translator processes the text, image, and voice data you submit, as well as device and usage data.

sentence: We use this data to provide Microsoft Translator, personalize your experiences, and improve our products and services.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft has implemented business and technical measures designed to help de-identify the data you submit to Microsoft Translator.
label: None

sentence: For example, when we randomly sample text and audio to improve Microsoft Translator and Microsoft’s speech recognition technologies, we delete identifiers and certain text, such as email addresses and some number sequences, detected in the sample that could contain personal data.
