sentence:
SwiftKey
The Microsoft Swiftkey keyboard and related cloud-based services (collectively, the “SwiftKey Services”) process data about words you use and how you type and use this data to learn your writing style and provide personalized autocorrection and predictive text that adapts to you.
label: None

sentence: We also use this data to offer a range of other features, such as hashtag and emoji predictions.
label: None

sentence: SwiftKey prediction technology learns from the way you use language to build a personalized language model.
label: None

sentence: This model is an optimized view of the words and phrases that you use most often in context and reflects your unique writing style.
label: None

sentence: The model itself contains the words you commonly type arranged in a way that enables SwiftKey’s algorithms to make predictions, based on text you have already entered.
label: None

sentence: The model draws from all scenarios in which you use your keyboard, including when you type while using apps or visiting websites.
label: None

sentence: The SwiftKey keyboard and model attempt to avoid collecting sensitive data, by not collecting data from certain fields such as those recognized as containing password or payment data.
label: None

sentence: SwiftKey Services do not log, store, or learn from data you type, or the data contained in your model, unless you choose to share your data with us (as described further below).
label: None

sentence: When you use SwiftKey Services, we also collect device and usage data.
label: None

sentence: We use de-identified device and usage data to analyze service performance and help improve our products.
label: None

sentence: The SwiftKey Services also include an optional cloud component called a SwiftKey Account.
label: None

sentence: If you choose to create a SwiftKey Account, your language model will be synced with the SwiftKey Account cloud service, so you can benefit from that model on the different devices you use and access additional services such as prediction synchronization and backup.
label: None

sentence: When you create a SwiftKey Account, Microsoft will also collect your email address and basic demographic data.
label: None

sentence: All data collected is transferred to our servers over encrypted channels.
label: None

sentence: You may also opt in to share your language, typing data, and/or voice clips for the purposes of improving Microsoft products and services.
label: None

sentence: Depending on the opt-ins you choose, SwiftKey may send
label: None

sentence: short snippets of data about what and how you type and/or your voice clips, and related correction data to our servers for processing.
label: None

sentence: These text snippets and/or voice clips are used in various automated processes to validate that our prediction services are working correctly and to make product improvements.
label: None

sentence: To preserve your privacy, SwiftKey Services de-identify
label: None

sentence: these text snippets, and even if you have a SwiftKey Account, these text snippets and/or voice clips will not be linked to it.
label: None

sentence: To learn more about how Microsoft manages your voice data, see Speech recognition technologies.
label: None

sentence: If you sign into your SwiftKey Account and opt to share your language and typing data or voice clips, Microsoft will process your shared data in order to look for new patterns of language usage across our user base.
label: None

sentence: This allows us to improve our basic models for individual languages.
label: None

sentence: Language and typing data used in this process is aggregated and any words or combinations of words that might be personal to individuals or small groups of users are filtered out.
label: None

sentence: You can withdraw your consent to share your language and typing data or voice clips for product improvement at any time in SwiftKey Settings.
label: None

sentence: You can also withdraw your consent for SwiftKey Services to retain your personal data in SwiftKey Settings.
label: None

sentence: When you withdraw consent for SwiftKey to retain your personal data, all personal data collected through your use of the SwiftKey Services will be deleted.
label: None

sentence: You may receive occasional notifications on your device alerting you to product updates and features that may be of interest to you.
label: None

sentence: You can disable these notifications at any time in the SwiftKey Settings.
label: None

sentence:
Windows
Windows is a personalized computing environment that enables you to seamlessly roam and access services, preferences, and content across your computing devices from phones to tablets to the Surface Hub.
label: None

sentence: Rather than residing as a static software program on your device, key components of Windows are cloud-based, and both cloud and local elements of Windows are updated regularly, providing you with the latest improvements and features.
label: None

sentence: In order to provide this computing experience, we collect data about you, your device, and the way you use Windows.
label: None

sentence: And because Windows is personal to you, we give you choices about the personal data
label: None

sentence: we collect and how we use it.
label: None

sentence: Note that if your Windows device is managed by your organization (such as your employer or school), your organization may use centralized
label: None

sentence: management tools provided by Microsoft or others to access and process your data and to control device settings (including privacy settings), device policies, software updates, data collection by us or the organization, or other aspects of your device.
label: None

sentence: Additionally, your organization may use management tools provided by Microsoft or others to access and process your data from that device, including your interaction data, diagnostic data, and the contents of your communications and files.
label: None

sentence: For more information about data collection and privacy in Windows, see Windows 10 and your online services.
label: None

sentence: Earlier versions of Windows (including Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8, and Windows 8.1) are subject to their own privacy statements.
label: None

sentence:
Activation
When you activate Windows, a specific product key is associated with the device on which your software is installed.
label: None

sentence: The product key and data about the software and your device is sent to Microsoft to help validate your license to the software.
label: None

sentence: This data may be sent again if there is a need to re-activate or validate your license.
label: None

sentence: On phones running Windows, device and network identifiers, as well as device location at the time of the first power-up of the device, are also sent to Microsoft for the purpose of warranty registration, stock replenishment, and fraud prevention.
label: None

sentence:
Activity history
Activity history helps keep track of the things you do on your device, such as the apps and services you use, the files you open, and the websites you browse.
label: None

sentence: Your activity history is stored locally on your device when using different apps and features such as Microsoft Edge, some Microsoft Store apps, and Microsoft 365 apps.
label: None

sentence: If you've signed in to your device with a Microsoft account and given your permission, Windows sends your activity history to Microsoft.
label: None

sentence: Once your activity history is in the cloud, Microsoft uses that data to enable cross-device experiences, to provide you with the ability to continue those activities on other devices, to provide personalized experiences (such as ordering your activities based on duration of use) and relevant suggestions (such as anticipating what your needs might be based on your activity history), and to help improve Microsoft products.
label: None

sentence: Activity history is also created and sent to Microsoft when you use Microsoft apps, such as Microsoft Edge, and Office apps like Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, on
label: None

sentence: mobile devices such as iOS and Android phones and tablets.
label: None

sentence: If you are signed in with your Microsoft account, you can continue activities on your Windows 10 device that you started in Microsoft apps on your Android or iOS device.
label: None

sentence: You can turn settings off or on for sending your activity history to Microsoft and storing activity history locally on your device, and you can also clear your device’s activity history at any time by going to Start > Settings > Privacy > Activity history.
label: None

sentence: Learn more about activity history in Windows 10.
label: None

sentence:
Advertising ID
Windows generates a unique advertising ID for each person using a device, which app developers and advertising networks can then use for their own purposes, including providing relevant advertising in apps.
label: None

sentence: When the advertising ID is enabled, both Microsoft apps and third-party apps can access and use the advertising ID in much the same way that websites can access and use a unique identifier stored in a cookie.
label: None

sentence: Thus, your advertising ID can be used by app developers and advertising networks to provide more relevant advertising and other personalized experiences across their apps and on the web.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft collects the advertising ID for the uses described here only when you choose to enable the advertising ID as part of your privacy setting.
label: None

sentence: The advertising ID setting applies to Windows apps using the Windows advertising identifier.
label: None

sentence: You can turn off access to this identifier at any time by turning off the advertising ID in Settings.
label: None

sentence: If you choose to turn it on again, the advertising ID will be reset and a new identifier will be generated.
label: None

sentence: When a third-party app accesses the advertising ID, its use of the advertising ID will be subject to its own privacy policy.
label: None

sentence:
Learn more about advertising ID in Windows 10.

The advertising ID setting does not apply to other methods of interest-based advertising delivered by Microsoft or third parties, such as cookies used to provide interest-based display ads on websites.
label: None

sentence: Third-party products accessed through or installed on Windows may also deliver other forms of interest-based advertising subject to their own privacy policies.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft delivers other forms of interest-based ads in certain Microsoft products, both directly and by partnering with third-party ad providers.
label: None

sentence: For more information on how Microsoft uses data for advertising, see the How we use personal data section of this statement.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft collects Windows diagnostic data to solve problems and to keep Windows up to date, secure, and operating properly.
label: None

sentence: It also helps us improve Windows and related Microsoft products and services and, for customers who have turned on the “Tailored experiences” setting, to provide more relevant tips and recommendations to tailor Microsoft and third-party products and services for Windows to the customer’s needs.
label: None

sentence: This data is transmitted to Microsoft and stored with one or more unique identifiers that can help us recognize an individual user on an individual device and understand the device's service issues and use patterns.
label: None

sentence: If an organization (such as your employer or school) uses Microsoft management tools or
label: None

sentence: engages Microsoft to manage your device, we and the organization will use and process diagnostic and error data from your device to allow the management, monitoring, and troubleshooting of the organization's devices, and for other purposes of the organization.
label: None

sentence: Required diagnostic data includes information about your device, its settings and capabilities, and whether it is performing properly.
label: None

sentence:
We collect the following Required diagnostic data:

Device, connectivity, and configuration data:
Data about the device
label: None

sentence: such as the processor type, OEM manufacturer, type of battery and capacity, number and type of cameras, firmware, and memory attributes.
label: None

sentence: Network capabilities and connection data such as the device’s IP address, mobile network (including IMEI and mobile operator), and whether the device is connected to a free or paid network.
label: None

sentence: Data about the operating system and its configuration such as the OS version and build number, region and language settings, diagnostics data settings, and whether the device is part of the Windows Insider program.
label: None

sentence: Data about connected peripherals such as model, manufacturer, drivers, and compatibility data.
label: None

sentence: Data about the applications installed on the device such as application name, version, and publisher.
label: None

sentence: Whether a device is ready for an update and whether there are factors that may impede the ability to receive updates, such as low battery, limited disk space, or connectivity through a paid network.
label: None

sentence: Whether updates complete successfully or fail.
label: None

sentence: Data about the reliability of the diagnostics collection system itself.
label: None

sentence: Basic error reporting, which is health data about the operating system and applications running on your device.
label: None

sentence: For example, basic error reporting tells us if an application, such as Microsoft Paint or a third-party game, hangs or crashes.
label: None

sentence: Optional diagnostic data includes more detailed information about your device and its settings, capabilities, and device health.
label: None

sentence: Optional diagnostic data also includes data about the websites you browse, device activity (also sometimes referred to as usage), and enhanced error reporting that helps Microsoft to fix and improve products and services for all users.
label: None

sentence:
When you choose to send Optional diagnostic data, Required diagnostic data will always be included, and we collect the following additional information:

Additional data about the device, connectivity, and configuration, beyond that collected under Required diagnostic data.
label: None

sentence: Status and logging information about the health of operating system and other system components beyond that collected about the update and diagnostics systems under Required diagnostic data.
label: None

sentence: App activity, such as which programs are launched on a device, how long they run, and how quickly they respond to input.
label: None

sentence: Browser activity, including browsing history and search terms, in Microsoft browsers (Microsoft Edge or Internet Explorer).
label: None

sentence: Enhanced error reporting, including the memory state of the device when a system or app crash occurs (which may unintentionally contain user content, such as parts of a file you were using when the problem occurred).
label: None

sentence: Crash data is never used for Tailored experiences as described below.
label: None

sentence: Some of the data described above may not be collected from your device even if you choose to send Optional diagnostic data.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft minimizes the volume of Optional diagnostic data it collects from all devices by collecting some of the data from only a subset of devices (sample).
label: None

sentence: By running the Diagnostic Data Viewer tool, you can see an icon which indicates whether your device is part of a sample and also which specific data is collected from your device.
label: None

sentence: Instructions for how to download the Diagnostic Data Viewer tool can be found at Start > Settings > Privacy > Diagnostics & feedback.
label: None

sentence: Specific data items collected in Windows diagnostics are subject to change to give Microsoft flexibility to collect the data needed for the purposes described.
label: None

sentence: For example, to ensure Microsoft can troubleshoot the latest performance issue impacting users’ computing experience or update a Windows 10 device that is new to the market, Microsoft may need to collect data items that were not collected previously.
label: None

sentence: For a current list of data types collected at Required diagnostic data and Optional diagnostic data, see Windows Required (Basic level) diagnostic events and fields or Windows 10 Optional (Full level) diagnostic data.
label: None

sentence: We provide limited portions of error report information to partners (such as the device manufacturer) to help them troubleshoot products and services which work with Windows and other Microsoft product and services.
label: None

sentence: They are only permitted to use this information to repair or improve those products and services.
label: None

sentence: We may also share some aggregated, de-identified diagnostic data, such as general usage trends for Windows apps and features, with selected third parties.
label: None

sentence:
Learn more about diagnostic data in Windows 10.

Inking and typing Recognition.
label: None

sentence: You also can choose to help Microsoft improve inking and typing recognition by sending inking and typing diagnostic data.
label: None

sentence: If you choose to do so, Microsoft will collect samples of the content you type or write to improve features such as handwriting recognition, autocompletion, next word prediction, and spelling correction in the many languages used by Windows customers.
label: None

sentence: When Microsoft collects inking and typing diagnostic data, it is divided into small samples and processed to remove unique identifiers, sequencing information, and other data (such as email addresses and numeric values) which could be used to reconstruct the original content or associate the input to you.
label: None

sentence: It also includes associated performance data, such as changes you manually make to text, as well as words you've added to the dictionary.
label: None

sentence: Learn more about improving inking and typing in Windows 10.
label: None

sentence: If you choose to turn on Tailored experiences, we will use your Windows diagnostic data (Basic or Full as you have selected) to offer you personalized tips, ads, and recommendations to enhance Microsoft experiences.
label: None

sentence: If you have selected Basic as your diagnostic data setting, personalization is based on information about your device, its settings and capabilities, and whether it is performing properly.
label: None

sentence: If you have selected Full, personalization is also based on information about how you use apps and features, plus additional information about the health of your device.
label: None

sentence: However, we do not use information about the websites you browse, the content of crash dumps, speech, typing, or inking input data for personalization when we receive such data from customers who have selected Full.
label: None

sentence: Tailored experiences include suggestions on how to customize and optimize Windows, as well as ads and recommendations for Microsoft and third-party products and services, features, apps, and hardware for your Windows experiences.
label: None

sentence: For example, to help you get the most out of your device, we may tell you about features you may not know about or that are new.
label: None

sentence: If you are having a problem with your Windows device, you may be offered a solution.
label: None

sentence: You may be offered a chance to customize your lock screen with pictures, or to be shown more pictures of the kind you like, or fewer of the ones you don’t. If you stream movies in your browser, you may be recommended an app from the Microsoft Store that streams more efficiently. Or, if you are running out of space on your hard drive, Windows may recommend you try OneDrive or purchase hardware to gain more space.
label: None

sentence: Learn more about tailored experiences in Windows 10.
label: None

sentence: Feedback
label: None

sentence: Feedback Hub is a
label: None

sentence: preinstalled app that provides a way to gather feedback on Microsoft products and installed first party and third-party apps.
label: None

sentence: You can sign into Feedback Hub using either your personal Microsoft account or an account provided by your organization (such as your employer or school) that you use to sign into Microsoft products.
label: None

sentence: Signing in with your work or school account allows you to submit feedback to Microsoft in association with your organization.
label: None

sentence: Any feedback you provide whether using your work or school account or personal Microsoft account may be publicly viewable depending on the settings configured by your organization’s administrators.
label: None

sentence: Additionally, if feedback is provided using your work or school account, your feedback can be viewed through the Feedback Hub by your organization’s administrators.
label: None

sentence: When you submit feedback to Microsoft about a problem or add more details to a problem, diagnostic data will be sent to Microsoft to improve Microsoft products and services.
label: None

sentence: Depending on your Diagnostic data settings in Start >
label: None

sentence: Settings > Privacy > Diagnostics & feedback,
label: None

sentence: Feedback Hub will either send diagnostic data automatically or you will have the option to send it to Microsoft at the time you provide feedback.
label: None

sentence: Based on the category chosen when submitting feedback, there may be additional personal data collected that helps to further troubleshoot issues;
label: None

sentence: for example, location related information when submitting feedback about location services or gaze related information when submitting feedback on Mixed Reality.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft may also share your feedback along with the data collected when you submit your feedback with Microsoft partners (such as a device manufacturer, or firmware developer) to help
label: None

sentence: them troubleshoot products and services that work with Windows and other Microsoft products and services.
label: None

sentence:
Learn more about diagnostic data in Windows 10.

Location services, motion sensing, and recording
Windows location service.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft operates a location service that helps determine the precise geographic location of a specific Windows device.
label: None

sentence: Depending on the capabilities of the device, the device’s location can be determined with varying degrees of accuracy and may in some cases be determined precisely.
label: None

sentence: When you have enabled location on a Windows device, or you have given permission for Microsoft apps to access location information on non-Windows devices, data about cell towers and Wi-Fi access points and their locations is collected by Microsoft and added to the location database after removing any data identifying the person or device from which it was collected.
label: None

sentence: This de-identified copy of location information is used to improve Microsoft's location services and, in some instances, shared with our location service provider partners, currently HERE (see https://www.here.com/), to improve the location services of the provider.
label: None

sentence: Windows services and features (such as browsers and Cortana), apps running on Windows, and websites opened in Windows browsers can access the device’s location through Windows if your settings allow them to do so.
label: None

sentence: Some features and apps request location permission when you first install Windows, some ask the first time you use the app, and others ask every time you access the device’s location.
label: None

sentence: For information about certain Windows apps that use the device’s location, see the Windows apps section of this privacy statement.
label: None

sentence: When an app or feature accesses the device’s location and you are signed in with a Microsoft account, your Windows device will also upload its location to the cloud where it is available across your devices to other apps or services that use your Microsoft account and for which you’ve granted permission.
label: None

sentence: We will retain only the last known location (each new location replaces the previous one).
label: None

sentence: Data about a Windows device's recent location history is also stored on the device even if not using a Microsoft account, and certain apps and Windows features can access this location history.
label: None

sentence: You can clear your device's location history at any time in the device's Settings menu.
label: None

sentence: In Settings, you can also view which apps have access to the device’s precise location or your device's location history, turn off or on access to the device’s location for particular apps, or turn off access to the device’s location.
label: None

sentence: You can also set a default location, which will be used when the location service can’t detect a more exact location for your device.
label: None

sentence: Even when you’ve turned off access to the device’s location, some third-party desktop apps and services could use other technologies (such as Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, cellular modem, etc.)
label: None

sentence: to determine the device’s precise location.
label: None

sentence: Learn more about third-party desktop apps and how they may still be able to determine your device’s location when the device’s location setting is off.
label: None

sentence: In addition, to facilitate getting help in an emergency, whenever you make an emergency call, Windows will attempt to determine and share your precise location, regardless of your location settings.
label: None

sentence: If your device has a SIM card or is otherwise using cellular service, your mobile operator will have access to your device’s location.
label: None

sentence: Learn more about location in Windows 10.
label: None

sentence: General Location.
label: None

sentence: If you turn on the General Location feature, apps that cannot use your precise location will have access to your general location, such as your city, postal code, or region.
label: None

sentence: Find My Phone.
label: None

sentence: The Find My Phone feature allows you to find the location of your Windows phone from the Microsoft account website, even if you have turned off all access to the location service on the phone.
label: None

sentence: If you have turned on the "save my location every few hours" feature in the Find My Phone settings on your phone, the Find My Phone feature will periodically send and store a single last-known location of your phone, even if you have turned off location services on your phone.
label: None

sentence: Each time a new location is sent, it replaces the previously-stored location.
label: None

sentence: Find my device.
label: None

sentence: The Find my device feature allows an administrator of a Windows portable device to find the location of that device from account.microsoft.com/devices.
label: None

sentence: To enable Find my device, an administrator needs to be signed in with a Microsoft account and have the location setting enabled.
label: None

sentence: This feature will work even if other users have denied access to location for all their apps.
label: None

sentence: When the administrator attempts to locate the device, users will see a notification in the notification area.
label: None

sentence:
Learn more about Find my device in Windows 10.

Windows motion sensing.
label: None

sentence: Windows devices with motion activity detection can collect motion activity.
label: None

sentence: This data can enable features such as a pedometer to count the number of steps you take, so a fitness application can estimate how many calories you burn.
label: None

sentence: This data and history is stored on your device and can be accessed by applications you give permission to access and use that data.
label: None

sentence: Recording.
label: None

sentence: Some Windows devices have a recording feature that allows you to capture audio and video clips of your activity on the device, including your communications with others.
label: None

sentence: If you choose to record a session, the recording will be saved locally on your device.
label: None

sentence: In some cases, you may have the option to transmit the recording to a Microsoft product or service that broadcasts the recording publicly.
label: None

sentence: Important: You should understand your legal responsibilities before recording and/or transmitting any communication.
label: None

sentence: This may include obtaining the prior consent of everyone participating in the conversation or any other authorizations as required.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft is not responsible for how you use recording features or your recordings.
label: None

sentence:
Security and safety features
Device encryption.
label: None

sentence: Device encryption helps protect the data stored on your device by encrypting it using BitLocker Drive Encryption technology.
label: None

sentence: When device encryption is on, Windows automatically encrypts the drive Windows is installed on and generates a recovery key.
label: None

sentence: The BitLocker recovery key for your personal device is automatically backed up online in your personal Microsoft OneDrive account.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft doesn't use your individual recovery keys for any purpose.
label: None

sentence: Malicious Software Removal Tool.
label: None

sentence: The Malicious Software Removal Tool (MSRT) runs on your device at least once per month as part of Windows Update.
label: None

sentence: MSRT checks devices for infections by specific, prevalent malicious software ("malware") and helps remove any infections found.
label: None

sentence: When the MSRT runs, it will
label: None

sentence: remove the malware listed on the Microsoft Support website if the malware is on your device.
label: None

sentence: During a malware check, a report will be sent to Microsoft with specific data about malware detected, errors, and other data about your device.
label: None

sentence: If you do not want MSRT to send this data to Microsoft, you can disable MSRT's reporting component.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft Family.
label: None

sentence: Parents can use Microsoft Family to understand and set boundaries on how their child is using their device.
label: None

sentence: There are many features available to Family members, so please carefully review the information provided when you create or join a Family.
label: None

sentence: When Family activity reporting is turned on for a child, Microsoft will collect details about how the child uses their device and provide parents with reports of that child's activities.
label: None

sentence: Activity reports are routinely deleted from Microsoft servers after a short period of time.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft Defender SmartScreen helps protect you when using our services by checking downloaded files and web content for malicious software, potentially unsafe web content, and other threats to you or your device.
label: None

sentence: When checking a file, data about that file is sent to Microsoft, including the file name, a hash of the file's contents, the download location, and the file's digital certificates.
label: None

sentence: If Microsoft Defender SmartScreen identifies the file as unknown or potentially unsafe, you will see a warning prior to opening the file.
label: None

sentence: When checking web content, data about the content and your device is sent to Microsoft, including the full web address of the content.
label: None

sentence: If Microsoft Defender SmartScreen detects that content is potentially unsafe, you will see a warning in place of the content.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft Defender SmartScreen can be turned on or off in Settings.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft Defender Antivirus looks for malware and other unwanted software, potentially unwanted apps, and other malicious content on your device.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft Defender Antivirus is automatically turned on to help protect your device if no other antimalware software is actively protecting your device.
label: None

sentence: If Microsoft Defender Antivirus is turned on, it will monitor the security status of your device.
label: None

sentence: When Microsoft Defender Antivirus is turned on, or is running because Limited Periodic Scanning is enabled, it will automatically send reports to Microsoft that contain data about suspected malware and other unwanted software, potentially unwanted apps, and other malicious content, and it may also send files that could contain malicious content, such as malware or unknown files for further inspection.
label: None

sentence: If a report is likely to contain personal data, the report is not sent automatically, and you'll be prompted before it is sent.
label: None

sentence: You can configure Microsoft Defender Antivirus not to send reports and suspected malware to Microsoft.
label: None

sentence:
Speech, Voice Activation, Inking, and Typing
Speech.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft provides both a device-based speech recognition feature and cloud-based (online) speech recognition technologies.
label: None

sentence: Turning on the online speech recognition setting lets you use Microsoft’s cloud-based speech recognition technologies in Cortana, the Mixed Reality Portal, dictation in Windows, supported Microsoft Store apps, and over time in other parts of Windows.
label: None

sentence: Turning on speech while setting up a HoloLens device or installing Windows Mixed Reality allows you to use your voice for commands, dictation, and app interactions.
label: None

sentence: Both device-based speech recognition and online speech recognition settings will be enabled.
label: None

sentence: With both settings enabled, while your headset is turned on the device will always be listening to your voice input and will send your voice data to Microsoft’s cloud-based speech recognition technologies.
label: None

sentence: When you use Microsoft’s cloud-based speech recognition technologies, Microsoft collects and uses your voice recordings to create a text transcription of the spoken words in the voice data.
label: None

sentence: To learn more about how Microsoft manages your voice data, see Speech recognition technologies.
label: None

sentence: You can use device-based speech recognition without sending your voice data to Microsoft.
label: None

sentence: However, Microsoft’s cloud-based speech recognition technologies provide more accurate recognition than the device-based speech recognition.
label: None

sentence: When the online speech recognition setting is turned off, speech services that don’t rely on the cloud and only use device-based recognition—like the Narrator app or the Windows Speech Recognition app—will still work.
label: None

sentence: If you’ve given permission in Cortana, we also collect additional information, like your name and nickname, your recent calendar events, and the names of the people in your appointments, information about your contacts including names and nicknames, names of your favorite places, apps you use, and information about your music preferences.
label: None

sentence: This additional data enables us to better recognize people, events, places, and music when you dictate commands, messages, or documents.
label: None

sentence: You can turn off online speech recognition at any time.
label: None

sentence: This will stop your voice data from being sent to Microsoft.
label: None

sentence: If you are using a HoloLens or mixed reality headset, you can also turn off device-based speech recognition at any time.
label: None

sentence: This will stop the device from listening for your voice input.
label: None

sentence: Learn more about speech recognition in Windows 10.
label: None

sentence: Voice Activation.
label: None

sentence: Windows provides supported apps with the ability to respond and take action based on voice keywords that are specific to that app—for example allowing Cortana to listen and respond to “Hey Cortana.
label: None

sentence: If you’ve given permission for an app to listen for voice keywords, Windows 10 will be actively listening to the microphone for these keywords.
label: None

sentence: Once a keyword is recognized, the app will have access to your voice recording, can process the recording, take action, and respond, such as with a spoken answer.
label: None

sentence: The app may send the voice recording to its own services in the cloud to process the commands.
label: None

sentence: Each app should ask you for permission before accessing voice recordings.
label: None

sentence: Additionally, voice activation can be enabled when the device is locked.
label: None

sentence: If enabled, the relevant
label: None

sentence: app will continue listening to the microphone for voice keywords when you have locked your device and can activate for anyone who speaks near the device.
label: None

sentence: When the device is locked, the app will have access to the same set of capabilities and information as when the device is unlocked.
label: None

sentence: You can turn off voice activation at any time.
label: None

sentence:
Learn more about voice activation in Windows 10.

Even when you’ve turned off voice activation, some third-party desktop apps and services could still be listening to the microphone and collect your voice input.
label: None

sentence: Learn more about third-party desktop apps and how they may still be able to access your microphone even with these settings turned off.
label: None

sentence: Your typed and handwritten words are collected to provide you with: a personal dictionary, better character recognition to help you type and write on your device, and text suggestions that appear as you type or write.
label: None

sentence: If you sync your Windows device settings to other Windows devices, your local user dictionary will be stored in your personal OneDrive for the purpose of enabling sharing of your dictionary with your other Windows devices.
label: None

sentence: Learn more about sync settings.
label: None

sentence: You can turn off Inking & typing personalization at any time.
label: None

sentence: This will delete data stored on your device, such as your local user dictionary.
label: None

sentence:
Learn more about inking & typing personalization in Windows 10.

Sync settings
When you sign in to Windows with a Microsoft account, Windows syncs some of your settings and data with Microsoft servers to make it easier to have personalized experiences across multiple devices.
label: None

sentence: After you've signed in to one or more devices with a Microsoft account, when you sign in to another with the same Microsoft account for the first time, Windows will download and apply the settings and data you choose to sync from your other devices.
label: None

sentence: Settings you choose to sync will automatically update on Microsoft servers and your other devices as you use them.
label: None

sentence: Some of the settings that are synced include:
label: None

sentence:
Apps you've installed from the Microsoft Store
Language preferences
Ease of Access preferences
Personalization settings such as your account picture, background, and mouse settings
Settings for Microsoft Store apps
Spell-checker dictionaries, input method editor (IME) dictionaries, and

sentence:
Windows Media Player
Windows Media Player allows you to play CDs, DVDs, and other digital content (such as WMA and MP3 files), rip CDs, and manage your media library.
label: None

sentence: To enrich your experience when you play content in your library, Windows Media player displays related media information, such as album title, song titles, album art, artist, and composer.
label: None

sentence: To augment your media information, Windows Media player will send a request to Microsoft which contains standard computer information, an identifier for the media content, and the media information already contained in your Windows Media Player library (including information you may have edited or entered yourself) so that Microsoft can recognize the track and then return additional information that is available.
label: None

sentence: Windows Media Player also allows you to play back content that is streamed to you over a network.
label: None

sentence: To provide this service, it is necessary for Windows Media Player to communicate with a streaming media server.
label: None

sentence: These servers are typically operated by non-Microsoft content providers.
label: None

sentence: During playback of streaming media, Windows Media Player will send a log to the streaming media server or other web server(s) if the streaming media server requests it.
label: None

sentence: The log includes such details as: connection time, IP address, operating system version, Windows Media Player version, Player identification number (Player ID), date, and protocol.
label: None

sentence: To protect your privacy, Windows Media Player defaults to sending a Player ID that is different for each session.
label: None

sentence:
Xbox
The Xbox network is the online gaming and entertainment service from Microsoft that consists of software and online experiences across different platforms.
label: None

sentence: This service lets you find and play games, view content, and connect with friends on Xbox and other gaming and social networks.
label: None

sentence: You can connect to the Xbox network using Xbox consoles, Windows 10 PCs, and mobile devices (Android and iPhone).
label: None

label: None

sentence: Xbox consoles are devices you can use to find and play games, movies, music, and other digital entertainment.
label: None

sentence: When you sign in to Xbox experiences—in apps or on a console—we also assign a unique device identifier.
label: None

sentence: When your Xbox console is connected to the internet, for instance, and you sign in to the console, we identify which console and which version of the console’s operating system you’re using.
label: None

sentence: Xbox continues to provide new experiences in client apps that are connected to and backed by services such as the Xbox network and cloud gaming.
label: None

sentence: To ensure these connected experiences remain reliable, up to date, secure, and performing as expected, required service data may be collected whenever you use a connected experience.
label: None

sentence:
Data we collect about your use of Xbox services, games, apps, and consoles includes:

When you sign in and sign out of Xbox, the games you play and apps you use, your game progress, achievements, and play statistics, any purchases you make, and content you obtain.
label: None

sentence: Performance data about Xbox consoles, Xbox Game Pass and other Xbox apps, the Xbox network, connected devices, and your network connection, including software or hardware errors.
label: None

sentence: Content you add, upload, or share through the Xbox network, including text, pictures, and video you capture in games and apps.
label: None

sentence: Social activity, including chat data and interactions with other gamers, and connections you make (friends you add and people who follow you) on the Xbox network.
label: None

sentence: If you use an Xbox console or Xbox app on another device capable of accessing the Xbox network, and that device includes a storage device (hard drive or memory unit), usage data will be stored on the storage device and sent to Microsoft the next time you sign in to Xbox, even if you’ve been playing offline.
label: None

sentence: Diagnostic data has two categories: required and optional.
label: None

sentence: If you use an Xbox console, the console will send required data to Microsoft.
label: None

sentence: Optional data is additional data that you choose to share with Microsoft.
label: None

sentence: Required.
label: None

sentence: The minimum data necessary to help keep Xbox safe, secure, up to date, and performing as expected.
label: None

sentence: Optional.
label: None

sentence: Learn more at Manage settings for optional data sharing.

sentence: Silverlight uses Microsoft Digital Rights Management (DRM) technology to help protect the rights of content owners.

sentence: If you access DRM-protected content (such as music or video) with Silverlight, it will request media usage rights from a rights server on the Internet.
label: None

sentence: In order to provide a seamless playback experience, you will not be prompted before Silverlight sends the request to the rights server.
label: None

sentence: When requesting media usage rights, Silverlight will provide the rights server with an ID for the DRM-protected content file and basic data about your device, including data about the DRM components on your device such as their revision and security levels, and a unique identifier for your device.
label: None

sentence: In some cases, accessing DRM-protected content will require an update to Silverlight or to the DRM components on your device.
label: None

sentence: The Microsoft server uses this identifier to return a unique DRM update for your device, which will then be installed by Silverlight.

sentence: You can turn off or configure DRM component updates on the Playback tab in the Silverlight Configuration tool.

How we use personal data
Microsoft uses the data we collect to provide you rich, interactive experiences.
label: None

sentence:
In particular, we use data to:

Provide our products, which includes updating, securing, and troubleshooting, as well as providing support.
label: None

sentence: It also includes sharing data, when it is required to provide the service or carry out the transactions you request.
label: None

sentence: Improve and develop our products.
label: None

sentence: Personalize our products and make recommendations.
label: None

sentence: Advertise and market to you, which includes sending promotional communications, targeting advertising, and presenting you relevant offers.
label: None

sentence: We also use the data to operate our business, which includes analyzing our performance, meeting our legal obligations, developing our workforce, and doing research.
label: None

sentence: For these purposes, we combine data we collect from different contexts (for example, from your use of two Microsoft products).
label: None

label: None

sentence: apps and services you use to make personalized app recommendations.

label: None

label: None

sentence: Our automated methods often are related to and supported by our manual methods.
label: None

sentence: For example, our automated methods include artificial intelligence (AI), which we think of as a set of technologies that enable computers to perceive, learn, reason, and assist in decision-making to solve problems in ways that are similar to what people do.
label: None

sentence: To build, train, and improve the accuracy of our automated methods of processing (including AI), we manually review some of the predictions and inferences produced by the automated methods against the underlying data from which the predictions and inferences were made.

label: None

More on the purposes of processing:

Provide our products.

sentence: We use data to operate our products and provide you with rich, interactive experiences.

sentence:
Our use of cookies and similar technologies

Microsoft uses cookies and similar technologies for several purposes, depending on the context or product, including:

Storing your preferences and settings.
label: None

sentence: We use cookies to store your preferences and settings on your device, and to enhance your experiences.
label: None

sentence: For example, depending on your settings, if you enter your city or postal code to get local news or weather information on a Microsoft website, we store that data in a cookie so that you will see the relevant local information when you return to the site.
label: None

sentence: Saving your preferences with cookies, such as your preferred language, prevents you from having to set your preferences repeatedly.
label: None

sentence: If you opt out of interest-based advertising, we store your opt-out preference in a cookie on your device.

sentence: Similarly, in scenarios where we obtain your consent to place cookies on your device, we store your choice in a cookie.

sentence: You can also save your sign-in information so you do not have to sign in each time you return to the site.

sentence:
Microsoft account
With a Microsoft account, you can sign into Microsoft products, as well as those of select Microsoft partners.
label: None

sentence: Personal data associated with your Microsoft account includes credentials, name and contact data, payment data, device and usage data, your contacts, information about your activities, and your interests and favorites.
label: None

sentence: Signing into your Microsoft account enables personalization, consistent experiences across products and devices, permits you to use cloud data storage, allows you to make payments using payment instruments stored in your Microsoft account, and enables other features.
label: None

sentence:
There are three types of Microsoft account:

When you create your own Microsoft account tied to your personal email address, we refer to that account as a personal Microsoft account.
label: None

sentence: When you or your organization (such as an employer or your school) create your Microsoft account tied to your email address provided by that organization, we refer to that account as a work or school account.
label: None

sentence: When you or your service provider (such as a cable or internet service provider) create your Microsoft account tied to your email address with your service provider’s domain, we refer to that account as a third-party account.
label: None

sentence: Personal Microsoft accounts.
label: None

sentence: The data associated with your personal Microsoft account, and how that data is used, depends on how you use the account.
label: None

sentence: Creating your Microsoft account.
label: None

sentence: When you create a personal Microsoft account, you will be asked to provide certain personal data and we will assign a unique ID number to identify your account and associated information.
label: None

sentence: While some products, such as those involving payment, require a real name, you can sign in to and use other Microsoft products without providing your real name.
label: None

sentence: Some data you provide, such as your display name, email address, and phone number, can be used to help others find and connect with you within Microsoft products.
label: None

sentence: For example, people who know your display name, email address, or phone number can use it to search for you on Skype or Microsoft Teams for personal use and send you an invite to connect with them.
label: None

sentence: Note that if you use a work or school email address to create a personal Microsoft account, your employer or school may gain access to your data.
label: None

sentence: In some cases, you will need to change the email address to a personal email address in order to continue accessing consumer-oriented products (such as the Xbox network).
label: None

sentence: Signing in to Microsoft account.
label: None

sentence: When you sign in to your Microsoft account, we create a record of your sign-in, which includes the date and time, information about the product you signed in to, your sign-in name, the unique number assigned to your account, a unique identifier assigned to your device, your IP address, and your operating system and browser version.
label: None

sentence: Signing in to Microsoft products.
label: None

sentence: Signing in to your account enables improved personalization, provides seamless and consistent experiences across products and devices, permits you to access and use cloud data storage, allows you to make payments using payment instruments stored in your Microsoft account, and enables other enhanced features and settings.
label: None

sentence: When you sign in to your account, you will stay signed in until you sign out.
label: None

sentence: If you add your Microsoft account to a Windows device (version 8 or higher), Windows will automatically sign you in to products that use Microsoft account when you access those products on that device.
label: None

sentence: When you are signed in, some products will display your name or username and your profile photo (if you have added one to your profile) as part of your use of Microsoft products, including in your communications, social interactions, and public posts.
label: None

sentence: Signing in to third-party products.
label: None

sentence: If you sign in to a third-party product with your Microsoft account, you will share data with the third party in accordance with the third party’s privacy policy.
label: None

sentence: The third party will also receive the version number assigned to your account (a new version number is assigned each time you change your sign-in data);
label: None

sentence: and information that describes whether your account has been deactivated.
label: None

sentence: If you share your profile data, the third party can display your name or user name and your profile photo (if you have added one to your profile) when you are signed in to that third-party product.
label: None

sentence: If you chose to make payments to third-party merchants using your Microsoft account, Microsoft will pass information stored in your Microsoft account to the third party or its vendors (e.g., payment processors) as necessary to process your payment and fulfill your order (such as name, credit card number, billing and shipping addresses, and relevant contact information).
label: None

sentence: The third party can use or share the data it receives when you sign in or make a purchase according to its own practices and policies.
label: None

sentence: You should carefully review the privacy statement for each product you sign in to and each merchant you purchase from to determine how it will use the data it collects.
label: None

sentence: Work or school accounts.
label: None

sentence: The data associated with a work or school account, and how it will be used, is generally similar to the use and collection of data associated with a personal Microsoft account.
label: None

sentence: If your employer or school uses Azure Active Directory (AAD) to manage the account it provides you, you can use your work or school account to sign in to Microsoft products, such as Microsoft 365 and Office 365, and third-party products provided to you by your organization.
label: None

sentence: If required by your organization, you will also be asked to provide a phone number or an alternative email address for additional security verification.
label: None

sentence: And, if allowed by your organization, you may also use your work or school account to sign in to Microsoft or third-party products that you acquire for yourself.
label: None

sentence:
If you sign in to Microsoft products with a work or school account, note:

The owner of the domain associated with your email address may control and administer your account, and access and process your data, including the contents of your communications and files, including data stored in products provided to you by your organization, and products you acquire by yourself.
label: None

sentence: Your use of the products is subject to your organization’s policies, if any.
label: None

sentence: You should consider both your organization’s policies and whether you are comfortable enabling your organization to access your data before you choose to use your work or school account to sign in to products you acquire for yourself.
label: None

sentence: If you lose access to your work or school account (if you change employers, for example), you may lose access to products, including content associated with those products, you acquired on your own behalf if you used your work or school account to sign in to such products.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft is not responsible for the privacy or security practices of your organization, which may differ from those of Microsoft.
label: None

sentence: If your organization is administering your use of Microsoft products, please direct your privacy inquiries, including any requests to exercise your data subject rights, to your administrator.
label: None

sentence: See also the Notice to end users section of this privacy statement.
label: None

sentence: If you are uncertain whether your account is a work or school account, please contact your organization.
label: None

sentence: Third-party accounts.
label: None

sentence: The data associated with a third-party Microsoft account, and how it will be used, is generally similar to the use and collection of data associated with a personal Microsoft account.
label: None

sentence: Your service provider has control over your account, including the ability to access or delete your account.
label: None

sentence: You should carefully review the terms the third party provided you to understand what it can do with your account.
label: None

sentence:
Collection of data from children
When a Microsoft product collects age, and there is an age in your jurisdiction under which parental consent or authorization is required to use the product, the product will either block users under that age or will ask them to provide consent or authorization from a parent or guardian before they can use it.
label: None

sentence: We will not knowingly ask children under that age to provide more data than is required to provide for the product.
label: None

sentence: Once parental consent or authorization is granted, the child's account is treated much like any other account.
label: None

sentence: The child can access communication services, like Outlook and Skype, and can freely communicate and share data with other users of all ages.
label: None

sentence: Learn more about parental consent and Microsoft child accounts.
label: None

sentence: Parents or guardians can change or revoke the consent choices previously made, and review, edit, or request the
label: None

sentence: deletion of the personal data of the children for whom they provided consent or authorization.
label: None

sentence: As the organizer of a Microsoft family group, the parent or guardian can manage a child’s information and settings on their Family Safety page and view and delete a child’s data on their privacy dashboard.
label: None

sentence: Below is additional information about the collection of data from children as related to Xbox.
label: None

sentence: What is Xbox?
label: None

sentence: Xbox is the gaming and entertainment division of Microsoft.
label: None

sentence: Xbox hosts an online network that consists of software and online experiences crossing multiple platforms.
label: None

sentence: This network lets your child find and play games, view content, and connect with friends on Xbox and other gaming and social networks.
label: None

sentence: Children can connect to the Xbox network using Xbox consoles, Windows 10 PCs, and mobile devices (Android and iPhone).
label: None

sentence: Xbox consoles are devices your child can use to find and play games, movies, music, and other digital entertainment.
label: None

sentence: When they sign in to Xbox, in apps, games or on a console, we assign a unique device identifier.
label: None

sentence: For instance, when their Xbox console is connected to the internet and they sign in to the console, we identify which console and which version of the console’s operating system they are using.
label: None

sentence: Xbox continues to provide new experiences in client apps that are connected to and backed by services such as Xbox network and cloud gaming.
label: None

sentence: To ensure these connected experiences remain reliable, up to date, secure, and performing as expected, required service data may be collected whenever your child uses a connected experience.
label: None

sentence: Data we collect when you create an Xbox profile.
label: None

sentence: You as the parent or guardian are required to consent to the collection of personal data from a child under 13 years old.
label: None

sentence: With your permission, your child can have an Xbox profile and use the online
label: None

sentence: Xbox network.
label: None

sentence: During the child Xbox profile creation, you will sign in with your own Microsoft account to verify that you are an adult organizer in your Microsoft family group.
label: None

sentence: We collect an alternate email address or phone number to boost account security.
label: None

sentence: If your child needs help accessing their account, they will be able to use one of these alternates to validate they own the Microsoft account.
label: None

sentence: We collect limited information about children, including name, birthdate, email address, and region.
label: None

sentence: When you sign your child up for an Xbox profile, they get a gamertag (a public nickname) and a unique identifier.
label: None

sentence: When you create your child’s Xbox profile you consent to Microsoft collecting, using, and sharing information based on their privacy and communication settings on the Xbox online network.
label: None

sentence: Your child’s privacy and communication settings are defaulted to the most restrictive.
label: None

sentence: Data we collect.
label: None

sentence:
We collect information about your child’s use of Xbox services, games, apps, and consoles including:

When they sign in and sign out of Xbox, the games they play and apps they use, their game progress, achievements, and play statistics, purchase history, and content they obtain.
label: None

sentence: Performance data about Xbox consoles, Xbox Game Pass and other Xbox apps, the Xbox network, connected devices, and network connection, including software or hardware errors.
label: None

sentence: Content they add, upload, or share through the Xbox network, including text, pictures, and video they capture in games and apps.
label: None

sentence: Social activity, including chat data and interactions with other gamers, and connections they make (friends they add and people who follow them) on the Xbox network.
label: None

sentence: If your child uses an Xbox console or
label: None

sentence: Xbox app on another device capable of accessing the Xbox network, and that device includes a storage device (hard drive or memory unit), usage data will be stored on the storage device and sent to Microsoft the next time they sign in to Xbox, even if they have been playing offline.
label: None

sentence: If your child uses an Xbox console, the console will send required data to Microsoft.
label: None

sentence: Required data is the minimum data necessary to help keep Xbox safe, secure, up to date, and performing as expected.
label: None

sentence: Any player in a multiplayer game session can record video (game clips) and capture screenshots of their view of the game play.
label: None

sentence: Other players’ game clips and screenshots can capture your child’s in-game character and gamertag during that session.
label: None

sentence: If a player captures game clips and screenshots on a PC, the resulting game clips might also capture audio chat if your child’s privacy and communication settings on the Xbox online network allow it.
label: None

sentence: Captioning.
label: None

sentence: During Xbox real-time (“party”) chat, players may activate a voice-to-text feature that lets them view that chat as text.
label: None

sentence: If a player activates this feature, Microsoft uses the resulting text data to provide captioning of chat for players who need it.
label: None

sentence: This data may also be used to provide a safe gaming environment and enforce the Community Standards for Xbox.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft uses the data we collect from your child’s use of Xbox consoles, Xbox apps, games, and the Xbox network to provide them with experiences—and make it safer and more fun over time.
label: None

sentence: Data we collect includes device information and game play statistics, such as the number of unique players and play time per game.
label: None

sentence: Data we collect also enables us to provide your child with personalized, curated experiences.
label: None

sentence: This includes connecting them to games, content, services, and recommendations.
label: None

sentence: Xbox data viewable by others.
label: None

sentence: When your child is using the Xbox network, their online presence (which can be set to “appear offline” or “blocked”), gamertag, game play statistics, and achievements are visible to other players on the network.
label: None

sentence: Depending on how you set your child’s Xbox safety settings, they might share information when playing or communicating with others on the Xbox network.
label: None

sentence: The Xbox network includes communications features such as text and voice, direct messaging, and real-time text and voice chat.
label: None

sentence: In order to help provide a safe gaming environment and enforce the Community Standards for Xbox, we collect and monitor text communications during hosted multiplayer game sessions, direct messages, and other features of the service, including activity feeds and clubs.
label: None

sentence: Xbox data shared with game and apps publishers.
label: None

sentence: When your child uses an Xbox online game or any network-connected app on their Xbox console, PC, or mobile device, the publisher of that game or app has access to data about their usage to help the publisher deliver, support, and improve its product.
label: None

sentence: This data may include: your child
label: None

sentence: ’s Xbox user identifier, gamertag, limited account info such as country and age range, data about your child’s in-game communications, any Xbox enforcement activity, game-play sessions (for example, moves made in-game or types of vehicles used in-game), your child’s presence on the Xbox network, the time they spend playing the game or app, rankings, statistics, gamer profiles, avatars, or gamerpics, friends lists, activity feeds for official clubs they belong to, official club memberships, and any content they create or submit in the game or app.
label: None

sentence: Third-party publishers and developers of games and apps have their own distinct and independent relationship with users and their collection and usage of personal data is subject to their specific privacy policies.
label: None

sentence: You should carefully review their policies to determine how they use your child’s data.
label: None

sentence: For example, publishers may choose to disclose or display game data (such as on leaderboards) through their own services.
label: None

sentence: You may find their policies linked from the game or
label: None

sentence: Learn more at Data Sharing with Games and Apps.
label: None

sentence: To stop sharing game or app data with a publisher, remove its games or app from all devices where they have been installed.
label: None

sentence: Some publisher access to your child’s data may be revoked at microsoft.com/consent.
label: None

sentence: Managing child settings.
label: None

sentence: As the organizer of a Microsoft family group, you can manage a child’s information and settings on their Family Safety page, as well as their Xbox profile privacy settings from their Xbox Privacy & online safety page.
label: None

sentence: You can also use the Xbox Family Settings app to manage your child’s experience on the Xbox Network including: spending for Microsoft and Xbox stores, viewing your child’s Xbox activity, and setting age ratings and the amount of screen time.
label: None

sentence: Learn more about managing Xbox profiles at
label: None

sentence: Xbox online safety and privacy settings.
label: None

sentence: Learn more about Microsoft family groups at Simplify your family’s life.
label: None

sentence: As the organizer of a Microsoft family group, a parent can view and delete a child’s data on their privacy dashboard.
label: None

sentence: The dashboard allows you to review your child's personal information, have it deleted, and refuse to permit further collection or use of your child's information.
label: None

sentence: To close your child’s account, sign in with their account info at  account.microsoft.com/profile and select ”How to close your account.”
label: None

sentence: This Xbox console collects limited required diagnostic data.
label: None

sentence: This data helps ensure your child’s console is functioning as expected.
label: None

sentence: Kinect.
label: None

sentence: The Kinect sensor is a combination of camera, microphone, and infrared sensor that can enable motions and voice to be used to control game play.
label: None

sentence: For example:
label: None

sentence: If you choose, the camera can be used to sign in to the Xbox network automatically using facial recognition.
label: None

sentence: This data stays on the console, is not shared with anyone, and can be deleted at any time.
label: None

sentence: For game play, Kinect will map distances between the joints on your child’s body to create a stick figure representation to enable play.
label: None

sentence: The Kinect microphone can enable voice chat between players during play.
label: None

sentence: The microphone also enables voice commands for control of the console, game, or app, or to enter search terms.
label: None

sentence: The Kinect sensor can also be used for audio and video communications through services such
label: None

sentence: Learn more about Kinect at Xbox Kinect and Privacy.
label: None

sentence:
Other important privacy information
Below you will find additional privacy information, such as how we secure your data, where we process your data, and how long we retain your data.
label: None

sentence: You can find more information on Microsoft and our commitment to protecting your privacy at Microsoft Privacy.
label: None

sentence:
Security of personal data
Microsoft is committed to protecting the security of your personal data.
label: None

sentence: We use a variety of security technologies and procedures to help protect your personal data from unauthorized access, use, or disclosure.
label: None

sentence: For example, we store the personal data you provide on computer systems that have limited access and are in controlled facilities.
label: None

sentence: When we transmit highly confidential data (such as a credit card number or password) over the internet, we protect it through the use of encryption.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft complies with applicable data protection laws, including applicable security breach notification laws.
label: None

sentence: Where we store and process personal data
label: None

sentence: Personal data collected by Microsoft may be stored and processed in your region, in the United States, and in any other country where Microsoft or its affiliates, subsidiaries, or service providers operate facilities.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft maintains major data centers in Australia, Austria, Brazil, Canada, Chile, Finland, France, Germany, Hong Kong, India, Ireland, Japan, Korea, Luxembourg, Malaysia, the Netherlands, Singapore, South Africa, the United Kingdom, and the United States.
label: None

sentence: Typically, the primary storage location is in the customer’s region or in the United States, often with a backup to a data center in another region.
label: None

sentence: The storage location(s)
label: None

sentence: are chosen in order to operate efficiently, to improve performance, and to create redundancies in order to protect the data in the event of an outage or other problem.
label: None

sentence: We take steps to ensure that the data we collect under this privacy statement is processed according to the provisions of this statement and the requirements of applicable law wherever the data is located.
label: None

sentence: We transfer personal data from the European Economic Area, the United Kingdom, and Switzerland to other countries, some of which have not yet been determined by the European Commission to have an adequate level of data protection.
label: None

sentence: For example, their laws may not guarantee you the same rights, or there may not be a privacy supervisory authority there that is capable of addressing your complaints.
label: None

sentence: When we engage in such transfers, we use a variety of legal mechanisms, including contracts such as the standard contractual clauses published by the European Commission under Commission Decision 2004/915/EC, to help ensure your rights and protections travel with your data.
label: None

sentence: To learn more about the European Commission’s decisions on the adequacy of the protection of personal data in the countries where Microsoft processes personal data, see this article on the European Commission website.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft Corporation complies with the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield Framework and Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield Framework as set forth by the U.S. Department of Commerce regarding the collection, use, and retention of personal information transferred from the European Union, the United Kingdom, and Switzerland to the United States, although Microsoft does not rely on the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield Framework as a legal basis for transfers of personal data in light of the judgment of the Court of Justice of the EU in Case C-311/18. Microsoft Corporation has certified to the Department of Commerce that it adheres to the Privacy Shield Principles.
label: None

sentence: If third-party agents process personal data on our behalf in a manner inconsistent with the principles of either Privacy Shield framework, we remain liable unless we prove we are not responsible for the event giving rise to the damage.
label: None

sentence: The controlled U.S. subsidiaries of Microsoft Corporation, as identified in our self-certification submission, also adhere to the Privacy Shield Principles—for more info, see the list of Microsoft U.S. entities or subsidiaries adhering to the Privacy Shield Principles.
label: None

sentence: If there is any conflict between the terms in this privacy policy and the Privacy Shield Principles, the Privacy Shield Principles shall govern.
label: None

sentence: To learn more about the Privacy Shield program, and to view our certification, visit the Privacy Shield website.
label: None

sentence: If you have a question or complaint related to participation by Microsoft in the EU-U.S. or
label: None

sentence: Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield, we encourage you to contact us via our web
label: None

sentence: For any complaints related to the Privacy Shield frameworks that Microsoft cannot resolve directly, we have chosen to cooperate with the relevant
label: None

sentence: EU Data Protection Authority, or a panel established by the European data protection authorities, for resolving disputes with EU individuals, and with the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC) for resolving disputes with Swiss individuals.
label: None

sentence: Please contact us if you’d like us to direct you to your data protection authority contacts.
label: None

sentence: As further explained in the Privacy Shield Principles, binding arbitration is available to address residual complaints not resolved by other means.
label: None

sentence: Microsoft is subject to the investigatory and enforcement powers of the U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC).
label: None

sentence:
Our retention of personal data
Microsoft retains personal data for as long as necessary to provide the products and fulfill the transactions you have requested, or for other legitimate purposes
label: None

sentence: such as complying with our legal obligations, resolving disputes, and enforcing our agreements.
label: None

sentence: Because these needs can vary for different data types, the context of our interactions with you or your use of products, actual retention periods can vary significantly.
label: None

sentence: Other criteria used to determine the retention periods include:
label: None

sentence: Do customers provide, create, or maintain the data with the expectation we will retain it until they affirmatively remove it?
label: None

sentence: Examples include a document you store in OneDrive, or an email message you keep in your Outlook.com inbox.
label: None

sentence: In such cases, we would aim to maintain the data until you actively delete it, such as by moving an email from your Outlook.com inbox to the Deleted Items folder, and then emptying that folder (when your Deleted Items folder is emptied, those emptied items remain in our system for up to 30 days before final deletion).
label: None

sentence: (Note that there may be other reasons why the data has to be deleted sooner, for example if you exceed limits on how much data can be stored in your account.)
label: None

sentence: Is there an automated control, such as in the Microsoft privacy dashboard, that enables the customer to access and delete the personal data at any time?
label: None

sentence: If there is not, a shortened data retention time will generally be adopted.
label: None

sentence: Is the personal data of a sensitive type?
label: None

sentence: If so, a shortened retention time would generally be adopted.
label: None

sentence: Has Microsoft adopted and announced a specific retention period for a certain data type?
label: None

sentence: For example, for Bing search queries, we de-identify stored queries by removing the entirety of the IP address after 6 months, and cookie IDs and other cross-session identifiers that are used to identify a particular account or device after 18 months.
label: None

sentence: Has the user provided consent for a longer retention period?
label: None

sentence: If so, we will retain data in accordance with your consent.
label: None

sentence: Is Microsoft subject to a legal, contractual, or similar obligation to retain or delete the data?
label: None

sentence: Examples can include mandatory data retention laws in the applicable jurisdiction, government orders to preserve data relevant to an investigation, or data retained for the purposes of litigation.
label: None

sentence: Conversely, if we are required by law to remove unlawful content, we will do so.
label: None

label: None

sentence: So, we do not offer an opt-out to the sale of personal data.
label: None

sentence: Rights.
label: None

label: None

sentence: You have a right not to receive discriminatory treatment if you exercise your CCPA rights.
